   19: %%
   20: -module(release_handler_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   24: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   25: 
   26: -compile([export_all, nowarn_export_all]).
   27: -export([scheduler_wall_time/0, garbage_collect/0]). %% rpc'ed
   28: 
   29: % Default timetrap timeout (set in init_per_testcase).
   30: %-define(default_timeout, test_server:minutes(40)).
   31: -define(default_timeout, test_server:minutes(10)).
   32: 
   33: suite() ->
   34:     [{ct_hooks, [ts_install_cth]}].
   35: 
   36: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   37:     init_priv_dir(Config),
   38:     application:start(sasl),
   39:     Config.
   40: 
   41: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   42:     clean_priv_dir(Config,true),
   43:     ok.
   44: 
   45: all() -> 
   46:     case os:type() of
   47: 	{unix, _} -> unix_cases();
   48: 	{win32, _} -> win32_cases()
   49:     end.
   50: 
   51: unix_cases() -> 
   52:     RunErl = filename:join([code:root_dir(),"bin","run_erl"]),
   53:     RunErlCases = case filelib:is_file(RunErl) of
   54: 		true ->  [{group, release}];
   55: 		false -> [no_run_erl]
   56: 	    end,
   57:     [target_system, target_system_unicode] ++ RunErlCases ++ cases().
   58: 
   59: win32_cases() ->
   60:     [{group,release} | cases()].
   61: 
   62: %% Cases that can be run on all platforms
   63: cases() ->
   64:     [otp_9395_check_old_code,
   65:      instructions, eval_appup, eval_appup_with_restart,
   66:      install_release_syntax_check,
   67:      otp_10463_upgrade_script_regexp, no_dot_erlang, move_system,
   68:      {group, absolute}, {group, relative}].
   69: 
   70: groups() ->
   71:     [{absolute,[],root_dir_cases()},
   72:      {relative,[],root_dir_cases()},
   73:      {release,[],
   74:       [
   75:        {group,release_single},
   76:        {group,release_gg}
   77:       ]},
   78:      {release_single,[],
   79:       [
   80:        upgrade,
   81:        upgrade_restart,
   82:        client1,
   83:        client2
   84:       ]},
   85:      {release_gg,[],
   86:       [
   87:        upgrade_gg
   88:       ]}].
   89: 
   90: %% Testcases that are to be run with and without an absolute root dir
   91: root_dir_cases() ->
   92:     [supervisor_which_children_timeout,
   93:      release_handler_which_releases,
   94:      otp_2760,
   95:      otp_5761,
   96:      otp_9402,
   97:      otp_9417,
   98:      otp_9395_check_and_purge,
   99:      otp_9395_update_many_mods,
  100:      otp_9395_rm_many_mods,
  101:      otp_9864,
  102:      upgrade_supervisor,
  103:      upgrade_supervisor_fail,
  104:      unicode_upgrade].
  105: 
  106: %% {group,release}
  107: %% Top group for all cases using run_erl
  108: init_per_group(release, Config) ->
  109:     case {os:type(), os:version()} of
  110: 	{{win32, nt}, Vsn} when Vsn > {6,1,999999} ->
  111: 	    {skip, "Requires admin privileges on Win 8 and later"};
  112: 	_ ->
  113: 	    Dog = test_server:timetrap(?default_timeout),
  114: 	    P1gInstall = filename:join(priv_dir(Config),p1g_install),
  115: 	    ok = create_p1g(Config,P1gInstall),
  116: 	    ok = create_p1h(Config),
  117: 	    test_server:timetrap_cancel(Dog)
  118:     end;
  119: 
  120: %% {group,release_single}
  121: %% Subgroup of {group,release}, contains all cases that are not
  122: %% related to global_group
  123: init_per_group(release_single, Config) ->
  124:     Dog = test_server:timetrap(?default_timeout),
  125: 
  126:     %% Create some more releases to upgrade to
  127:     ok = create_p1i(Config),
  128:     ok = create_p2a(Config),
  129:     ok = create_p2b(Config),
  130: 
  131:     test_server:timetrap_cancel(Dog);
  132: 
  133: %% {group,release_gg}
  134: %% Subgroup of {group,release}. global_group tests.
  135: init_per_group(release_gg, Config0) ->
  136:     Config = [{sname_prefix,release_gg}|Config0],
  137: 
  138:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Config),
  139:     Dog = test_server:timetrap(?default_timeout),
  140: 
  141:     reg_print_proc(), %% starts a printer process on this node
  142: 
  143:     Snames = [Gg1Sname,Gg2Sname,Gg3Sname,Gg4Sname,Gg5Sname,Gg6Sname] =
  144: 	gg_node_snames(Config),
  145: 
  146:     %% kill all possible nodes which are to be used
  147:     ok = stop_nodes([node_name(Sname) || Sname <- Snames]),
  148: 
  149:     %% For gg1, gg3, gg4 and gg5: create a target system running
  150:     %% P1G, and with P1H unpacked.
  151:     %% For gg2 and gg6: create a target system running P1H.
  152:     %% Use gg2 for unpacking and permanenting P1H.
  153:     ok = copy_installed(Config,p1g_install,[Gg2Sname]),
  154:     InstallNode = unpack_p1h(Config,Gg2Sname),
  155:     ok = copy_installed(Config,Gg2Sname,[Gg1Sname,Gg3Sname,Gg4Sname,Gg5Sname]),
  156:     ok = permanent_p1h(InstallNode),
  157:     ok = stop_nodes([InstallNode]),
  158:     ok = copy_installed(Config,Gg2Sname,[Gg6Sname]),
  159: 
  160:     %% Replace the sys.config files
  161:     %% The reason for not creating the releases with these configs in
  162:     %% the first place (create_p1g, create_p1h) is that then the
  163:     %% InstallNode (gg2) will be very slow started since it will try
  164:     %% to synch with the other nodes in the global group.
  165:     %% Also, the rpc call for installing the P1H release (in
  166:     %% permanent_p1h/1) would return {rpc,nodedown} due to change of
  167:     %% global groups.
  168:     lists:foreach(
  169:       fun(Sname) ->
  170: 	      ReleasesDir = filename:join([PrivDir,Sname,"releases"]),
  171: 	      write_term_file(filename:join([ReleasesDir,"P1G","sys.config"]),
  172: 			      gg_config([Gg1Sname,Gg3Sname,Gg4Sname,Gg5Sname])),
  173: 	      write_term_file(filename:join([ReleasesDir,"P1H","sys.config"]),
  174: 			      gg_config([Gg1Sname,Gg2Sname,Gg4Sname,
  175: 					 Gg5Sname,Gg6Sname]))
  176:       end,
  177:       Snames),
  178: 
  179:     test_server:timetrap_cancel(Dog),
  180:     [{snames,Snames}|Config];
  181: init_per_group(Group, Config) when Group =:= absolute;
  182:                                    Group =:= relative ->
  183:     [{root_dir, Group}|Config].
  184: 
  185: end_per_group(release, Config) ->
  186:     Dog = test_server:timetrap(?default_timeout),
  187:     stop_print_proc(),
  188:     case os:type() of
  189: 	{win32,_} -> delete_all_services();
  190: 	_ -> ok
  191:     end,
  192:     test_server:timetrap_cancel(Dog),
  193:     Config;
  194: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  195:     Config.
  196: 
  197: 
  198: init_per_testcase(Case, Config0) ->
  199:     Dog = test_server:timetrap(?default_timeout),
  200:     Config = [{sname_prefix,Case},{watchdog, Dog}|Config0],
  201:     try apply(?MODULE,Case,[cleanup,Config])
  202:     catch error:undef -> ok
  203:     end,
  204:     test_server:format("~n======= init_per_testcase done =======~n",[]),
  205:     Config.
  206: 
  207: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) ->
  208:     test_server:format("~n======= start end_per_testcase =======~n",[]),
  209:     Dog=?config(watchdog, Config),
  210:     test_server:timetrap_cancel(Dog),
  211: 
  212:     try apply(?MODULE,Case,[cleanup,Config])
  213:     catch error:undef -> ok
  214:     end,
  215: 
  216:     %% DEBUG
  217:     case ?config(tc_status,Config) of
  218: 	ok ->
  219: 	    ok;
  220: 	_Fail ->
  221: 	    %% save logs from master and client nodes
  222: 	    PrivDir = priv_dir(Config),
  223: 	    SaveDir = filename:join(PrivDir,save),
  224: 	    FailDir = filename:join(SaveDir,lists:concat(["failed-",Case])),
  225: 	    ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(FailDir,"*")),
  226: 
  227: 	    LogDirs =
  228: 		filelib:wildcard(filename:join([PrivDir,"*",log])) ++
  229: 		filelib:wildcard(filename:join([PrivDir,"*",clients,
  230: 						type1,"*",log])),
  231: 
  232: 	    lists:foreach(
  233: 	      fun(LogDir) ->
  234: 		      ["log",Sname|_] = lists:reverse(filename:split(LogDir)),
  235: 		      copy_tree(Config,LogDir,Sname,FailDir)
  236: 	      end,
  237: 	      LogDirs),
  238: 
  239: 	    case filelib:is_file("sasl_erl_crash.dump") of
  240: 		true ->
  241: 		    copy_file("sasl_erl_crash.dump",FailDir);
  242: 		_ ->
  243: 		    ok
  244: 	    end
  245: 
  246:     end,
  247:     %% End DEBUG
  248: 
  249:     %% Remove any remaining sasl_erl_crash.dump
  250:     %% These can occur when a new master@<host> is started, before
  251:     %% the old usage of the name is unregistered, causing the node to
  252:     %% terminate. (This has no effect on the test case, as the node is
  253:     %% immediately restarted by heart and the test cases wait until
  254:     %% the node is actually up and running -- see wait_nodes_up/2)
  255:     file:delete("sasl_erl_crash.dump"),
  256:     ok.
  257: 
  258: gg_node_snames(Config) ->
  259:     [tc_sname(Config,X) || X <- [gg1,gg2,gg3,gg4,gg5,gg6]].
  260: 
  261: 
  262: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  263: %%% TEST CASES
  264: 
  265: %% Test that a release can be location independent (i.e., if all
  266: %% paths related to the release are relative to the ROOTDIR of the
  267: %% release, then one can move the release to a different directory and
  268: %% it should still work).
  269: move_system(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  270: 
  271:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Conf),
  272:     TestRootDir = filename:join(priv_dir(Conf), ?FUNCTION_NAME),
  273:     ErtsBinDir = filename:join("erts-" ++ find_vsn_app(erts), "bin"),
  274: 
  275:     %% Remove old test data
  276:     file:del_dir_r(filename:join(TestRootDir,"system")),
  277:     file:del_dir_r(filename:join(TestRootDir,"system_moved")),
  278:     file:del_dir_r(filename:join(TestRootDir,"system_moved_again")),
  279: 
  280:     %% Create TAR file for release A
  281:     ReleaseATarFile = create_release_package(DataDir, "hello_server", "A"),
  282:     SystemPath = filename:join(TestRootDir, "system"),
  283:     ok = erl_tar:extract(ReleaseATarFile, [{cwd, SystemPath}, compressed]),
  284:     RelDir = filename:join(SystemPath, "releases"),
  285:     SystemRelFile = filename:join(RelDir, "hello_server-A.rel"),
  286: 
  287:     %% Create a location independent RELEASES file. Library paths in the releases
  288:     %% file are assumed to be relative to the RootDir.
  289:     ok = release_handler:create_RELEASES(RelDir, SystemRelFile, []),
  290: 
  291:     %% Create the bin directory with links (or copies on windows) to the erts directory
  292:     file:make_dir(filename:join(SystemPath,"bin")),
  293:     case os:type() of
  294:         {win32, _} ->
  295:             {ok,_} = file:copy(
  296:                        filelib:wildcard(filename:join([SystemPath,ErtsBinDir,"erl.exe"])),
  297:                        filename:join([SystemPath,"bin","erl.exe"]));
  298:         _ ->
  299:             ok = file:make_symlink(
  300:                    filename:join(["..",ErtsBinDir,"erl"]),
  301:                    filename:join([SystemPath,"bin","erl"]))
  302:     end,
  303: 
  304:     %% Test that the location independent system can start and run
  305:     {ok, Peer, Node} = start_remote_node(SystemPath, "A"),
  306:     hello = erpc:call(Node, app_callback_module, get_response, []),
  307:     peer:stop(Peer),
  308: 
  309:     %% Should still work after copying the system and corrupting the source
  310:     NewSystemPath = filename:join(TestRootDir, "system_moved"),
  311:     copy_r(SystemPath, NewSystemPath),
  312:     [file:del_dir_r(F) || F <- filelib:wildcard(filename:join([SystemPath,"lib","stdlib*"]))],
  313:     file:del_dir_r(filename:join(SystemPath,"releases")),
  314:     {ok, MovedPeer, MovedNode} = start_remote_node(NewSystemPath, "A"),
  315:     hello = erpc:call(MovedNode, app_callback_module, get_response, []),
  316:     peer:stop(MovedPeer),
  317: 
  318:     %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  319:     %% Let us now try if a system upgrade also works with a location independent system %
  320:     %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  321:     ReleaseBTarFile = create_release_package(DataDir, "hello_server_new", "B"),
  322: 
  323:     BPackDest = filename:join([NewSystemPath, "releases", filename:basename(ReleaseBTarFile)]),
  324:     {ok, _ } = file:copy(ReleaseBTarFile, BPackDest),
  325:     BTarFileName = filename:basename(ReleaseBTarFile),
  326:     NameToUnpack = filename:rootname(BTarFileName, ".tar.gz"),
  327:     %% Start remote node with release A
  328:     {ok, PeerA, NodeA} = start_remote_node(NewSystemPath, "A"),
  329: 
  330:     %% Set current working directory to something irrelevant as the
  331:     %% current working directory should not affect if a system is
  332:     %% location independent or not
  333:     ok = erpc:call(NodeA, file, set_cwd, ["/"]),
  334:     %% Let us check our app
  335:     hello = erpc:call(NodeA, app_callback_module, get_response, []),
  336:     %% Install the next release
  337:     {ok, "B"} = erpc:call(NodeA, release_handler, unpack_release, [NameToUnpack]),
  338:     %% We can now create relup file
  339:     AppUpSrc = filename:join([DataDir, "relocatable_release", "hello_server_new",
  340:                               "ebin", "hello_server.appup"]),
  341:     AppUpDest = filename:join([NewSystemPath, "lib", "hello_server-B", "ebin", "hello_server.appup"]),
  342:     {ok, _} = file:copy(AppUpSrc, AppUpDest),
  343:     %% Run command to create the relup file
  344:     ok = systools:make_relup(
  345:            filename:join([NewSystemPath, "releases", "B", "hello_server-B"]),
  346:            [filename:join([NewSystemPath, "releases", "A", "hello_server-A"])],
  347:            [filename:join([NewSystemPath, "releases", "A", "hello_server-A"])],
  348:            [{outdir,filename:join([NewSystemPath, "releases","B"])},
  349:             {path,[NewSystemPath ++ "/lib/hello_server-A/ebin/",
  350:                    NewSystemPath ++ "/lib/hello_server-B/ebin/"]}]
  351:           ),
  352:     %% Install the B version
  353:     {ok, "A", _} = erpc:call(NodeA, release_handler, install_release, ["B"]),
  354:     %% Check that the releases info looks ok
  355:     true = lists:any(fun({"hello_server", "B", _, current}) ->
  356:                              true;
  357:                         (_) ->
  358:                              false
  359:                      end,
  360:                      erpc:call(NodeA, release_handler, which_releases, [])),
  361:     %% Make sure the old module gets replaced
  362:     ok = erpc:call(NodeA, app_callback_module, update, []),
  363:     %% Check that the upgrade worked
  364:     hej = erpc:call(NodeA, app_callback_module, get_response, []),
  365: 
  366:     case os:type() of
  367:         {win32, _} ->
  368:             %% We cannot make release permanent on windows due to
  369:             %% not having permissions to edit services.
  370:             %% And symlinks to do not on windows, so we don't test
  371:             %% anything more there.
  372:             peer:stop(PeerA);
  373:         _ ->
  374:             move_system_unix(NodeA, PeerA, TestRootDir, ErtsBinDir, NewSystemPath)
  375: 
  376:     end.
  377: 
  378: move_system_unix(NodeA, PeerA, TestRootDir, ErtsBinDir, NewSystemPath) ->
  379:     %% Make the upgrade permanent
  380:     ok = erpc:call(NodeA, release_handler, make_permanent, ["B"]),
  381:     %% Check that it still works
  382:     hej = erpc:call(NodeA, app_callback_module, get_response, []),
  383:     true = lists:any(fun({"hello_server", "B", _, permanent}) ->
  384:                              true;
  385:                         (_) ->
  386:                              false
  387:                      end,
  388:                      erpc:call(NodeA, release_handler, which_releases, [])),
  389:     ok = peer:stop(PeerA),
  390: 
  391:     %% We will now move the install and check that everything still seems to be working fine
  392:     NewSystemPath2 = filename:join(TestRootDir, "system_moved_again"),
  393:     ok = file:rename(NewSystemPath, NewSystemPath2),
  394: 
  395:     %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  396:     %% Create a symlink to moved system and test that if we set the path to
  397:     %% contain the symlink it will work.
  398:     %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  399:     ok = file:make_symlink(
  400:            filename:join([NewSystemPath2, ErtsBinDir, "erl"]),
  401:            filename:join(TestRootDir, "erl")),
  402: 
  403:     Name = peer:random_name(),
  404:     LinkNode = list_to_atom(Name++"@"++lists:last(string:split(atom_to_list(node()),"@"))),
  405: 
  406:     %% We cannot use ?CT_PEER here because it uses spawn_executable and that
  407:     %% does not search the PATH for which program to run.
  408:     Port = open_port(
  409:              {spawn,"erl -sname " ++ Name ++ " -boot " ++
  410:                   filename:join([NewSystemPath2, "releases", "B", "start"])},
  411:              [{env,[{"PATH",TestRootDir ++ ":" ++ os:getenv("PATH")}]}]),
  412: 
  413:     %% Wait for node to start
  414:     receive M1 -> ct:pal("~p",[M1]) end,
  415:     receive M2 -> ct:pal("~p",[M2]) end,
  416: 
  417:     hej = erpc:call(LinkNode, app_callback_module, get_response, []),
  418: 
  419:     true = catch port_close(Port),
  420:     ct:log("~p",[(fun F() -> receive M -> [M | F()] after 0 -> [] end end)()]),
  421: 
  422:     %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  423:     %% Test that we can do a downgrade of the moved system
  424:     %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
  425:     {ok, PeerB, NodeB} = start_remote_node(NewSystemPath2, "B"),
  426: 
  427:     %% Change current working directory to something irrelevant
  428:     ok = erpc:call(NodeB, file, set_cwd, ["/"]),
  429:     {ok, "/"} = erpc:call(NodeB, file, get_cwd, []),
  430:     %% Check that we are using version B
  431:     hej = erpc:call(NodeB, app_callback_module, get_response, []),
  432:     %% Downgrade to version A
  433:     {ok, "A", _} = erpc:call(NodeB, release_handler, install_release, ["A"]),
  434:     true = lists:any(fun({"hello_server", "A", _, current}) ->
  435:                              true;
  436:                         (_) ->
  437:                              false
  438:                      end,
  439:                      erpc:call(NodeB, release_handler, which_releases, [])),
  440:     %% Make sure that the module is reloaded
  441:     ok = erpc:call(NodeB, app_callback_module, update, []),
  442:     %% Make sure that we are on version A
  443:     hello = erpc:call(NodeB, app_callback_module, get_response, []),
  444:     %% Make the downgrade permanent
  445:     ok = erpc:call(NodeB, release_handler, make_permanent, ["A"]),
  446:     %% Test that remove release works
  447:     ok = erpc:call(NodeB, release_handler, remove_release, ["B"]),
  448:     %% B should not exist anymore
  449:     false = lists:any(fun({"hello_server", "B", _, _}) ->
  450:                               true;
  451:                          (_) ->
  452:                               false
  453:                       end,
  454:                       erpc:call(NodeB, release_handler, which_releases, [])),
  455:     ok = erpc:call(NodeB, app_callback_module, update, []),
  456:     %% We should still get hello
  457:     hello = erpc:call(NodeB, app_callback_module, get_response, []),
  458:     ok = peer:stop(PeerB),
  459: 
  460:     ok.
  461: 
  462: start_remote_node(SystemPath, RelVsn) ->
  463:     SystemErlPath = filename:join([SystemPath, "bin", "erl"]),
  464:     ?CT_PEER(#{ exec => SystemErlPath,
  465:                 args => ["-boot",filename:join([SystemPath,"releases", RelVsn, "start"])]}).
  466: 
  467: create_release_package(DataDir, SourceDir, RelVsn) ->
  468:     ReleaseSource = filename:join(DataDir, "relocatable_release"),
  469:     AppSrc = filename:join(ReleaseSource, SourceDir),
  470:     OldCWD = file:get_cwd(),
  471:     file:set_cwd(AppSrc),
  472:     os:cmd("erl -make"),
  473:     file:set_cwd(OldCWD),
  474:     RelFileScr = filename:join(ReleaseSource, "hello_server-"++ RelVsn ++".rel.src"),
  475:     RelFileDst = filename:join(ReleaseSource, "hello_server-"++ RelVsn ++".rel"),
  476:     {ok, RelFileTxt1} = file:read_file(RelFileScr),
  477:     RelFileTxt = fix_rel_file_vsns(["erts", "kernel", "stdlib", "sasl"],
  478:                                    RelFileTxt1),
  479:     ok = file:write_file(RelFileDst, RelFileTxt),
  480:     AppPath = filename:join([ReleaseSource, SourceDir, "ebin"]),
  481:     RelFileWithoutEnding = filename:join(ReleaseSource, "hello_server-" ++ RelVsn),
  482:     ok = systools:make_script(RelFileWithoutEnding, [local, {path, [AppPath]}]),
  483:     ok = systools:make_tar(RelFileWithoutEnding, [{erts, code:root_dir()}, {path, [AppPath]}]),
  484:     SystemPath = filename:join(ReleaseSource, "system"),
  485:     file:make_dir(SystemPath),
  486:     InitialTarPath = filename:join(ReleaseSource, "hello_server-"++ RelVsn ++".tar.gz"),
  487:     InitialTarPath.
  488: 
  489: fix_rel_file_vsns(Apps, Txt) ->
  490:     Res =
  491:         lists:foldl(
  492:           fun(App, TxtAcc) ->
  493:                   string:replace(TxtAcc,
  494:                                  "%" ++  App ++ "_VSN" ++ "%" ,
  495:                                  find_vsn_app(erlang:list_to_atom(App)))
  496:           end,
  497:           Txt,
  498:           Apps),
  499:     erlang:iolist_to_binary(lists:flatten(Res)).
  500: 
  501: find_vsn_app(erts) ->
  502:     Str = erlang:system_info(system_version),
  503:     {match, [{Start, Len} | _]} = re:run(Str, "erts-(\\d\\.?)+"),
  504:     ErtsStr = string:substr(Str, Start+1, Len),
  505:     [_, Vsn] = string:split(ErtsStr, "-"),
  506:     Vsn;
  507: find_vsn_app(App) ->
  508:     Apps = application:which_applications(),
  509:     [Vsn] = [Vsn || {AppX, _, Vsn} <- Apps, AppX =:= App],
  510:     Vsn.
  511: 
  512: 
  513: %% Executed instead of release group when no run_erl program exists
  514: no_run_erl(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  515:     {comment, "No run_erl program"}.
  516: 
  517: break(Config) ->
  518: 	erlang:display(test_break),
  519: 	test_server:break(priv_dir(Config)),
  520: 	ok.
  521: 
  522: %% Test upgrade and downgrade of erts and other apps on embedded node
  523: upgrade(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  524:     reg_print_proc(), %% starts a printer process on test_server node
  525:     test_server:format("upgrade ~p~n",[reg_print_proc]),
  526:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
  527:     Sname = tc_sname(Conf), % nodename for use in this testcase
  528: 
  529:     %% Copy the P1G release to a directory for use in this testcase
  530:     ok = copy_installed(Conf,p1g_install,[Sname]),
  531: 
  532:     %% start the test node
  533:     [TestNode] = start_nodes(Conf,[Sname],"upgrade start"),
  534: 
  535:     %% unpack and install P1H
  536:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_1, [PrivDir]),
  537:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  538:     reboot_and_wait(TestNode,"install_1"),
  539: 
  540:     %% reinstall P1H and make it permanent
  541:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_2, []),
  542:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  543:     reboot_and_wait(TestNode,"install_2",[a]),
  544: 
  545:     %% check that P1H is permanent, unpack and install P1I, unpack P2A
  546:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_3, [PrivDir]),
  547:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  548:     reboot_and_wait(TestNode,"install_3",[a]),
  549: 
  550:     %% check that P1H is used, install P2A
  551:     TestNodeInit1 = rpc:call(TestNode,erlang,whereis,[init]),
  552:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  553:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_4, []),
  554:     wait_nodes_up([{TestNode,TestNodeInit1}],"install_4",[a]),
  555: 
  556:     %% check that P2A is used, then downgrade to P1I
  557:     TestNodeInit2 = rpc:call(TestNode,erlang,whereis,[init]),
  558:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_5, []),
  559:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  560:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_5a, []),
  561:     wait_nodes_up([{TestNode,TestNodeInit2}],"install_5",[a]),
  562: 
  563:     %% Check that P1I is used, then make P1I permanent and install P2A
  564:     TestNodeInit3 = rpc:call(TestNode,erlang,whereis,[init]),
  565:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_6, []),
  566:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  567:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_6a, []),
  568:     wait_nodes_up([{TestNode,TestNodeInit3}],"install_6",[a]),
  569: 
  570:     %% check that P2A is used, then downgrade to P1H
  571:     TestNodeInit4 = rpc:call(TestNode,erlang,whereis,[init]),
  572:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_7, []),
  573:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  574:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_7a, []),
  575:     wait_nodes_up([{TestNode,TestNodeInit4}],"install_7",[a]),
  576: 
  577:     %% check that P1H is used, then install P1I and check that it is permanent
  578:     %% then reinstall P2A
  579:     TestNodeInit5 = rpc:call(TestNode,erlang,whereis,[init]),
  580:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_8, []),
  581:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  582:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_8a, []),
  583:     wait_nodes_up([{TestNode,TestNodeInit5}],"install_8",[a]),
  584: 
  585:     %% check that P2A is used, make P2A permanent
  586:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_9, []),
  587:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  588:     reboot_and_wait(TestNode,"install_9",[a]),
  589: 
  590:     %% check that P2A is permanent, reboot to old P1H
  591:     TestNodeInit6 = rpc:call(TestNode,erlang,whereis,[init]),
  592:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  593:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_10, []),
  594:     wait_nodes_up([{TestNode,TestNodeInit6}],"install_10",[a]),
  595: 
  596:     %% check that P1H is permanent, remove P1I and P2A
  597:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_11, []),
  598:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  599:     reboot_and_wait(TestNode,"install_11",[a]),
  600: 
  601:     %% check that P1H is permanent, reboot old P1G
  602:     TestNodeInit7 = rpc:call(TestNode,erlang,whereis,[init]),
  603:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  604:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_12, []),
  605:     wait_nodes_up([{TestNode,TestNodeInit7}],"install_12"),
  606: 
  607:     %% check that P1G is permanent, remove P1H
  608:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_13, []),
  609:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  610:     reboot_and_wait(TestNode,"install_13"),
  611: 
  612:     %% check that P1G is permanent
  613:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, install_14, []),
  614: 
  615:     ok.
  616: 
  617: upgrade(cleanup,Config) ->
  618:     TestNode = tc_full_node_name(Config),
  619:     ok = stop_nodes([TestNode]).
  620: 
  621: reboot_and_wait(Node,Tag) ->
  622:     reboot_and_wait(Node,Tag,[]).
  623: 
  624: reboot_and_wait(Node,Tag,Apps) ->
  625:     InitPid = rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[init]),
  626:     ok = rpc:call(Node,init,reboot,[]),
  627:     wait_nodes_up([{Node,InitPid}],Tag,Apps).
  628: 
  629: 
  630: %% Test upgrade and downgrade of erts in combination with the
  631: %% restart_emulator option to systools:make_relup. For upgrade, this
  632: %% should cause one restart before the upgrade code, and one
  633: %% after. For downgrade, there will be one restart only - at the end.
  634: upgrade_restart(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  635:     reg_print_proc(), %% starts a printer process on test_server node
  636:     test_server:format("upgrade_restart ~p~n",[reg_print_proc]),
  637:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
  638:     Sname = tc_sname(Conf), % nodename for use in this testcase
  639: 
  640:     %% Copy the P1G release to a directory for use in this testcase
  641:     ok = copy_installed(Conf,p1g_install,[Sname]),
  642: 
  643:     %% start the test node
  644:     [TestNode] = start_nodes(Conf,[Sname],"upgrade_restart start"),
  645: 
  646:     %% unpack and install P2B
  647:     TestNodeInit1 = rpc:call(TestNode,erlang,whereis,[init]),
  648:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, upgrade_restart_1, [PrivDir]),
  649:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  650:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, upgrade_restart_1a, []),
  651:     wait_nodes_up([{TestNode,TestNodeInit1}],"upgrade_restart_1",[a]),
  652: 
  653:     %% install P1G
  654:     case rpc_inst(TestNode, upgrade_restart_2, []) of
  655: 	ok ->
  656: 	    ok;
  657: 	{wait,TestNodeInit2a} ->
  658: 	    %% We caught the node too early - it was supposed to
  659: 	    %% restart twice, so let's wait for one more restart.
  660: 	    wait_nodes_up([{TestNode,TestNodeInit2a}],"upgrade_restart_2a",[]),
  661: 	    ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, upgrade_restart_2a, [])
  662:     end,
  663:     TestNodeInit2 = rpc:call(TestNode,erlang,whereis,[init]),
  664:     stop_cover(TestNode),
  665:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, upgrade_restart_2b, []),
  666:     wait_nodes_up([{TestNode,TestNodeInit2}],"upgrade_restart_2b",[]),
  667: 
  668:     %% Check that P1G is going again
  669:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, upgrade_restart_3, []),
  670: 
  671:     ok.
  672: 
  673: upgrade_restart(cleanup,Config) ->
  674:     TestNode = tc_full_node_name(Config),
  675:     ok = stop_nodes([TestNode]).
  676: 
  677: 
  678: %% Test upgrade and downgrade of erts, diskless
  679: client1(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  680:     reg_print_proc(), %% starts a printer process on test_server node
  681:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
  682:     Master = tc_sname(Conf,master),
  683:     Client = tc_sname(Conf,client),
  684:     MasterDir = filename:join(PrivDir,Master),
  685: 
  686:     %% Copy the P1G release to a directory for use in this testcase
  687:     ok = copy_installed(Conf,p1g_install,[Master]),
  688:     ok = copy_client(Conf,Master,Client,client1),
  689: 
  690:     %% start the master node
  691:     [TestNode] = start_nodes(Conf,[Master],"client1"),
  692: 
  693:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, client1_1, [PrivDir,MasterDir,Client]),
  694: 
  695:     ok.
  696: 
  697: client1(cleanup,Config) ->
  698:     MasterNode = tc_full_node_name(Config,master),
  699:     ClientNode = tc_full_node_name(Config,client),
  700:     ok = stop_nodes([MasterNode,ClientNode]).
  701: 
  702:

  705: client2(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  706:     reg_print_proc(), %% starts a printer process on test_server node
  707:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
  708:     Master = tc_sname(Conf,master),
  709:     Client = tc_sname(Conf,client),
  710: 
  711:     %% Copy the P1G release to a directory for use in this testcase
  712:     ok = copy_installed(Conf,p1g_install,[Master]),
  713:     ok = copy_client(Conf,Master,Client,client2),
  714: 
  715:     %% start the master node
  716:     [TestNode] = start_nodes(Conf,[Master],"client2"),
  717: 
  718:     ok = rpc_inst(TestNode, client2, [PrivDir,Client]),
  719: 
  720:     ok.

  723:     MasterNode = tc_full_node_name(Config,master),
  724:     ClientNode = tc_full_node_name(Config,client),

  728: 
  729: %% Test instructions _not_ tested by the installer module.
  730: instructions(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
  731:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Conf),
  732: 
  733:     Dir = filename:join(DataDir, "c"),
  734:     true = code:add_path(Dir),
  735:     check_bstate("no", []),
  736:     ok = application:start(c),
  737:     ok = wait_for(bb),
  738:     check_bstate("first", []),
  739:     FirstBB = whereis(bb),
  740: 
  741:     case whereis(cc) of
  742:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) -> ok;
  743:         _ -> ct:fail("cc not started")
  744:     end,
  745: 
  746:     %% Stop and start cc process
  747:     S1 = [point_of_no_return,
  748:           {stop, [aa]},
  749:           {apply, {?MODULE, no_cc, []}},
  750:           {start, [aa]}],
  751:     {ok, _} = release_handler_1:eval_script(S1),
  752: 
  753:     case whereis(cc) of
  754:         Pid2 when is_pid(Pid2) -> ok;
  755:         _ -> ct:fail("cc not started")
  756:     end,
  757: 
  758:     %% Make bb run old version of b.
  759:     S2 = [point_of_no_return,
  760:           {remove, {b, soft_purge, soft_purge}}],
  761:     {ok, [{b, soft_purge}]} = release_handler_1:eval_script(S2),
  762:     check_bstate("first", [FirstBB]),
  763: 
  764:     false = code:is_loaded(b),
  765:     {error,{old_processes,b}} = release_handler_1:eval_script(S2),
  766:     check_bstate("first", [FirstBB]),
  767: 
  768:     %% Let supervisor restart bb with new code
  769:     S3 = [point_of_no_return,
  770:           {purge, [b]}],
  771:     {ok, []} = release_handler_1:eval_script(S3),
  772:     ok = wait_for(bb),
  773:     check_bstate("second", []),
  774:     SecondBB = whereis(bb),
  775: 
  776:     if
  777:         SecondBB =:= FirstBB -> ct:fail("bb not killed");
  778:         true -> ok
  779:     end,
  780: 
  781:     %% Restart bb yet another time
  782:     ok = application:stop(c),
  783:     ok = application:start(c),
  784:     ok = wait_for(bb),
  785:     check_bstate("third", []),
  786:     ThirdBB = whereis(bb),
  787: 
  788:     case ThirdBB of
  789:         _ when is_pid(ThirdBB) -> ok;
  790:         undefined -> ct:fail("bb not started")
  791:     end,
  792: 
  793:     %% Make bb run old version of b.
  794:     %%c:l(b),
  795:     check_bstate("third", []),
  796:     false = code:purge(b),
  797:     check_bstate("third", []),
  798:     {module,b} = code:load_file(b),
  799:     check_bstate("third", [ThirdBB]),
  800: 
  801:     %% Let supervisor restart bb yet another time
  802:     S4 = [point_of_no_return,
  803:           {remove, {b, brutal_purge, soft_purge}}],
  804:     {ok, HopefullyEmpty} = release_handler_1:eval_script(S4),
  805:     ok = wait_for(bb),
  806:     FourthBB = whereis(bb),
  807: 
  808:     case HopefullyEmpty of
  809: 	[{b, soft_purge}] ->
  810: 	    %% The process managed to start between purge and delete
  811: 	    check_bstate("fourth", [FourthBB]);
  812: 	[] ->
  813: 	    %% The process started after delete
  814: 	    check_bstate("fourth", [])
  815:     end,
  816: 
  817:     application:stop(c),
  818:     check_bstate("no", []),
  819:     ok.
  820: 
  821: instructions(cleanup,Conf) ->
  822:     application:stop(c),
  823:     really_del_code([aa,b,c_sup]),
  824:     code:del_path(filename:join(?config(data_dir,Conf), "c")),
  825:     ok.
  826: 
  827: really_del_code(Mods) ->
  828:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) ->
  829: 			  code:purge(Mod), % remove old code
  830: 			  code:delete(Mod),% make current code old
  831: 			  code:purge(Mod)  % remove old code
  832: 		  end,
  833: 		  Mods).
  834: 
  835: check_bstate(Slogan,ExpectedProcs) ->
  836:     BB = whereis(bb),
  837:     ActualProcs = lists:sort([P || P <- processes(),
  838: 				   erlang:check_process_code(P, b)]),
  839:     ExpectedProcs2 = lists:sort(ExpectedProcs),
  840:     test_server:format("check_bstate:~n~p~n~p~n",
  841: 	      [{"bb process", Slogan, BB},
  842: 	       {"Processes running old b code", ActualProcs}]),
  843:     if
  844: 	Slogan =:= "no", BB =/= undefined ->
  845: 	    ct:fail("instructions failed; process bb is running");
  846: 	Slogan =/= "no", BB =:= undefined ->
  847: 	    ct:fail("instructions failed; process bb is not running");
  848: 	ExpectedProcs2 =:= [], ActualProcs =/= ExpectedProcs2 ->
  849: 	    ct:fail("instructions failed; old b processes are running");
  850: 	ActualProcs =/= ExpectedProcs2 ->
  851: 	    ct:fail("instructions failed; wrong number of old b processes are running");
  852: 	true ->
  853: 	    ok
  854:     end.
  855: 
  856: wait_for(Name) ->
  857:     case whereis(Name) of
  858:         undefined ->
  859:             timer:sleep(100),
  860:             wait_for(Name);
  861:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
  862:             ok
  863:     end.
  864: 
  865: no_cc() ->
  866:     case whereis(cc) of
  867:         Pid when is_pid(Pid) -> ct:fail("cc not stopped");
  868:         _ -> ok
  869:     end.
  870: 
  871: 
  872:

  877: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  878: %% release_handler_1:get_supervised_procs/0 test
  879: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  880: supervisor_which_children_timeout(Conf) ->
  881:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
  882:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"supervisor_which_children_timeout"),
  883:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Conf),
  884:     LibDir = filename:join([DataDir,release_handler_timeouts]),
  885: 
  886:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,[{dummy,"0.1",LibDir}]),
  887: 
  888:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(supervisor_which_children_timeout, Rel1, []),
  889:     Proc = rpc:call(Node, erlang, whereis, [dummy_sup_2]),
  890:     ok = rpc:call(Node, sys, suspend, [Proc]),
  891:     Result = {badrpc, {'EXIT', {suspended_supervisor, _}}} =
  892:         rpc:call(Node, release_handler_1, get_supervised_procs, []),
  893:     test_server:format("release_handler_1:get_supervised_procs/0: ~p~n", [Result]),
  894: 
  895:     ok.
  896: 
  897: supervisor_which_children_timeout(cleanup, _Conf) ->
  898:     stop_node(node_name(supervisor_which_children_timeout)).
  899:

  902: %% instructions, even after point of no return.

  904: 
  905:     S1 = [point_of_no_return, illegal_instruction],
  906:     {error,{illegal_instruction_after_point_of_no_return,illegal_instruction}} =
  907: 	release_handler_1:check_script(S1,[]),
  908: 
  909:     S2 = [point_of_no_return,restart_new_emulator],
  910:     {error,{illegal_instruction_after_point_of_no_return,restart_new_emulator}} =
  911: 	release_handler_1:check_script(S2,[]),
  912: 
  913:     ok.

  920:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
  921:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"release_handler_which_releases"),
  922:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Conf),
  923:     LibDir = filename:join([DataDir,release_handler_timeouts]),
  924: 
  925:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,[{dummy,"0.1",LibDir}]),
  926: 
  927:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(release_handler_which_releases, Rel1, []),
  928:     Releases0 = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, which_releases, []),
  929:     Releases1 = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, which_releases, [permanent]),
  930:     Releases2 = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, which_releases, [old]),
  931: 
  932:     1 = length(Releases0),
  933:     1 = length(Releases1),
  934:     0 = length(Releases2),
  935: 
  936:     test_server:format("release_handler:which_releases/0: ~p~n", [Releases0]),
  937:     test_server:format("release_handler:which_releases/1: ~p~n", [Releases1]),
  938:     test_server:format("release_handler:which_releases/1: ~p~n", [Releases2]),
  939: 
  940:     ok.
  941: 
  942: release_handler_which_releases(cleanup,_Conf) ->
  943:     stop_node(node_name(release_handler_which_releases)).

  945: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  946: %% Ticket: OTP-2740
  947: %% Slogan: vsn not numeric doesn't work so good in release_handling
  948: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  949: %% Test vsn.
  950: otp_2740(Conf) ->
  951:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Conf),
  952:     Dir = filename:join(DataDir, "otp_2740"),
  953:     true = code:add_path(Dir),
  954: 
  955:     {module, vsn_numeric} = c:l(vsn_numeric),
  956:     {module, vsn_tuple} = c:l(vsn_tuple),
  957:     {module, vsn_list} = c:l(vsn_list),
  958:     {module, vsn_atom} = c:l(vsn_atom),
  959:     {module, vsn_string} = c:l(vsn_string),
  960: 
  961:     231894 = release_handler_1:get_current_vsn(vsn_numeric),
  962:     {tuple,["of",terms]} = release_handler_1:get_current_vsn(vsn_tuple),
  963:     [list,"of",{some,terms}] = release_handler_1:get_current_vsn(vsn_list),
  964:     atom = release_handler_1:get_current_vsn(vsn_atom),
  965:     "a string" = release_handler_1:get_current_vsn(vsn_string),
  966: 
  967:     true = code:del_path(Dir),
  968:     ok.
  969: 
  970: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  971: %% Ticket: OTP-2760
  972: %% Slogan: when an application is removed from a node it is not unloaded
  973: %%-----------------------------------------------------------------
  974: %% Test that when an application is removed from a node it is also unloaded.
  975: otp_2760(Conf) ->
  976:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
  977:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"otp_2760"),
  978:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Conf),
  979:     LibDir = filename:join([DataDir,app1_app2,lib1]),
  980: 
  981:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,[{app1,"1.0",LibDir}]),
  982:     Rel2 = create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,"after",[],{[Rel1],[Rel1],[LibDir]}),
  983:     Rel2Dir = filename:dirname(Rel2),
  984: 
  985:     %% Start a node with Rel1.boot and check that the app1 module is loaded
  986:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(otp_2760, Rel1, []),
  987:     {file, _} = rpc:call(Node, code, is_loaded, [app1]),
  988: 
  989:     %% Execute the relup script and check that app1 is unloaded
  990:     {ok, [{"after", [{_Rel1Vsn, _Descr, Script}], _}]} =
  991: 	file:consult(filename:join(Rel2Dir, "relup")),
  992:     {ok, []} = rpc:call(Node, release_handler_1, eval_script, [Script]),
  993:     false = rpc:call(Node, code, is_loaded, [app1]),
  994: 
  995:     ok.
  996: 
  997: otp_2760(cleanup,_Conf) ->
  998:     stop_node(node_name(otp_2760)).

 1000: 
 1001: %% Test upgrade using other filesystem than the defined in OTP and
 1002: %% option {update_paths, true}
 1003: otp_5761(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1004: 
 1005:     %% In the following test case, the release upgrade is somewhat
 1006:     %% simplified (since it is not this procedure in itself we want to
 1007:     %% test, but that application code directories are set correctly.)
 1008:     %% Existing Erlang release is used as base, instead of creating
 1009:     %% a new one.
 1010: 
 1011:     %% Set some paths
 1012:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 1013:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"otp_5761"),
 1014:     RelDir = filename:join(?config(data_dir, Conf), "app1_app2"),
 1015:     LibDir1 = filename:join(RelDir, "lib1"),
 1016:     LibDir2 = filename:join(RelDir, "lib2"),
 1017: 
 1018:     %% Create the releases
 1019:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,
 1020: 						 [{app1,"1.0",LibDir1},
 1021: 						  {app2,"1.0",LibDir1}]),
 1022:     Rel2 = create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,
 1023: 				       "2",
 1024: 				       [{app1,"2.0",LibDir2},
 1025: 					{app2,"1.0",LibDir2}],
 1026: 				       {[Rel1],[Rel1],[LibDir1]}),
 1027:     Rel1Dir = filename:dirname(Rel1),
 1028:     Rel2Dir = filename:dirname(Rel2),
 1029:     
 1030:     %% Start a slave node
 1031:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(otp_5761, Rel1, filename:join(Rel1Dir,"sys.config")),
 1032: 
 1033:     %% Bind some variable names that will be used in patternmatching below 
 1034:     App11Dir = filename:join([LibDir1, "app1-1.0"]),
 1035:     App12Dir = filename:join([LibDir2, "app1-2.0"]),
 1036:     App2aDir = filename:join([LibDir1, "app2-1.0"]),
 1037:     App2bDir = filename:join([LibDir2, "app2-1.0"]),
 1038: 
 1039:     %% Make sure correct code paths are used
 1040:     App11Dir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [app1]),
 1041:     App2aDir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [app2]),
 1042: 
 1043:     %% Unpack rel2 (make sure it does not work if an AppDir is bad)
 1044:     LibDir3 = filename:join(RelDir, "lib3"),
 1045:     {error, {no_such_directory, _}} =
 1046: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, set_unpacked,
 1047: 		 [Rel2++".rel", [{app1,"2.0",LibDir2}, {app2,"1.0",LibDir3}]]),
 1048:     {ok, RelVsn2} =
 1049: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, set_unpacked,
 1050: 		 [Rel2++".rel", [{app1,"2.0",LibDir2}, {app2,"1.0",LibDir2}]]),
 1051:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1052: 			[RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "relup")]),
 1053:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1054: 			[RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "start.boot")]),
 1055:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1056: 			[RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "sys.config")]),
 1057: 
 1058:     %% Install RelVsn2 without {update_paths, true} option
 1059:     {ok, RelVsn1, []} =
 1060: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn2]),
 1061:     App12Dir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [app1]),
 1062:     App2aDir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [app2]),
 1063: 
 1064:     %% Install RelVsn1 again
 1065:     {ok, RelVsn1, []} =
 1066: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn1]),
 1067: 
 1068:     %% Install RelVsn2 with {update_paths, true} option
 1069:     {ok, RelVsn1, []} =
 1070: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release,
 1071: 		 [RelVsn2, [{update_paths, true}]]),
 1072:     App12Dir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [app1]),
 1073:     App2bDir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [app2]),
 1074: 
 1075:     %% Install RelVsn1 again
 1076:     {ok, RelVsn1, []} =
 1077: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release,
 1078: 		 [RelVsn1, [{update_paths, true}]]),
 1079:     App11Dir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [app1]),
 1080:     App2aDir = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [app2]),
 1081: 
 1082:     ok.
 1083: 
 1084: otp_5761(cleanup,_Conf) ->
 1085:     stop_node(node_name(otp_5761)).
 1086: 
 1087: 
 1088: %% When a new version of an application is added, but no module is
 1089: %% changed - the path was not updated - i.e. code:priv_dir would point
 1090: %% to the old location.
 1091: otp_9402(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1092:     %% Set some paths
 1093:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 1094:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"otp_9402"),
 1095:     LibDir = filename:join(?config(data_dir, Conf), "lib"),
 1096: 
 1097:     %% Create the releases
 1098:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,
 1099: 						 [{a,"1.1",LibDir}]),
 1100:     Rel2 = create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,
 1101: 				       "2",
 1102: 				       [{a,"1.2",LibDir}],
 1103: 				       {[Rel1],[Rel1],[LibDir]}),
 1104:     Rel1Dir = filename:dirname(Rel1),
 1105:     Rel2Dir = filename:dirname(Rel2),
 1106: 
 1107:     %% Start a slave node
 1108:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(otp_9402, Rel1, filename:join(Rel1Dir,"sys.config")),
 1109: 
 1110:     %% Check path
 1111:     Dir1 = filename:join([LibDir, "a-1.1"]),
 1112:     Dir1 = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [a]),
 1113:     ABeam = rpc:call(Node, code, which, [a]),
 1114: 
 1115:     %% Install second release, with no changed modules
 1116:     {ok, RelVsn2} =
 1117: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, set_unpacked,
 1118: 		 [Rel2++".rel", [{a,"1.2",LibDir}]]),
 1119:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1120: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "relup")]),
 1121:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1122: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "start.boot")]),
 1123:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1124: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "sys.config")]),
 1125: 
 1126:     {ok, RelVsn1, []} =
 1127: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn2]),
 1128: 
 1129:     %% Check path
 1130:     Dir2 = filename:join([LibDir, "a-1.2"]),
 1131:     Dir2 = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [a]),
 1132:     APrivDir2 = rpc:call(Node, code, priv_dir, [a]),
 1133:     true = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(APrivDir2,"file")),
 1134: 
 1135:     %% Just to make sure no modules have been re-loaded
 1136:     ABeam = rpc:call(Node, code, which, [a]),
 1137: 
 1138:     %% Install RelVsn1 again
 1139:     {ok, _OtherVsn, []} =
 1140: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn1]),
 1141: 
 1142:     %% Check path
 1143:     Dir1 = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [a]),
 1144:     APrivDir1 = rpc:call(Node, code, priv_dir, [a]),
 1145:     false = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(APrivDir1,"file")),
 1146: 
 1147:     %% Just to make sure no modules have been re-loaded
 1148:     ABeam = rpc:call(Node, code, which, [a]),
 1149: 
 1150:     ok.
 1151: 
 1152: otp_9402(cleanup,_Conf) ->
 1153:     stop_node(node_name(otp_9402)).
 1154: 
 1155: 
 1156: %% When a module is deleted in an appup instruction, the upgrade
 1157: %% failed if the module was not loaded.
 1158: otp_9417(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1159:     %% Set some paths
 1160:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 1161:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"otp_9417"),
 1162:     LibDir = filename:join(?config(data_dir, Conf), "lib"),
 1163: 
 1164:     %% Create the releases
 1165:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,
 1166: 						 [{b,"1.0",LibDir}]),
 1167:     Rel2 = create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,
 1168: 				       "2",
 1169: 				       [{b,"2.0",LibDir}],
 1170: 				       {[Rel1],[Rel1],[LibDir]}),
 1171:     Rel1Dir = filename:dirname(Rel1),
 1172:     Rel2Dir = filename:dirname(Rel2),
 1173: 
 1174:     %% Start a slave node
 1175:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(otp_9417, Rel1, filename:join(Rel1Dir,"sys.config")),
 1176: 
 1177:     %% Check paths
 1178:     Dir1 = filename:join([LibDir, "b-1.0"]),
 1179:     Dir1 = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [b]),
 1180:     BLibBeam = filename:join([Dir1,"ebin","b_lib.beam"]),
 1181:     BLibBeam = rpc:call(Node,code,which,[b_lib]),
 1182:     false = rpc:call(Node,code,is_loaded,[b_lib]),
 1183:     false = rpc:call(Node,code,is_loaded,[b_server]),
 1184: 
 1185:     %% Install second release, which removes b_lib module
 1186:     {ok, RelVsn2} =
 1187: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, set_unpacked,
 1188: 		 [Rel2++".rel", [{b,"2.0",LibDir}]]),
 1189:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1190: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "relup")]),
 1191:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1192: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "start.boot")]),
 1193:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1194: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "sys.config")]),
 1195: 
 1196:     {ok, _RelVsn1, []} =
 1197: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn2]),
 1198: 
 1199:     %% Check that the module does no longer exist
 1200:     false = rpc:call(Node, code, is_loaded, [b_lib]),
 1201:     non_existing = rpc:call(Node, code, which, [b_lib]),
 1202: 
 1203:     %% And check some paths
 1204:     Dir2 = filename:join([LibDir, "b-2.0"]),
 1205:     Dir2 = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [b]),
 1206:     BServerBeam = filename:join([Dir2,"ebin","b_server.beam"]),
 1207:     {file,BServerBeam} = rpc:call(Node,code,is_loaded,[b_server]),
 1208:     ok.
 1209: 
 1210: otp_9417(cleanup,_Conf) ->
 1211:     stop_node(node_name(otp_9417)).
 1212: 
 1213: 
 1214: %% OTP-9395 - performance problems when there are MANY processes
 1215: %% Test that the procedure of checking for old code before an upgrade
 1216: %% can be started is faster when there is no old code in
 1217: %% the system.
 1218: otp_9395_check_old_code(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1219: 
 1220:     NProcs = 1000,
 1221:     MPath = filename:join([?config(data_dir,Conf),"lib","many_mods-1.0","ebin"]),
 1222:     code:add_path(MPath),
 1223: 
 1224:     %% Start NProc processes, each referencing each module
 1225:     {Modules,Pids} = m:start(NProcs),
 1226: 
 1227:     %% Load each module again in order to get old code
 1228:     [code:load_file(Mod) || Mod <- Modules],
 1229:     true = erlang:check_old_code(m10),
 1230: 
 1231:     S = [point_of_no_return |
 1232: 	 [{remove,{M,soft_purge,soft_purge}} || M <- Modules]],
 1233: 
 1234:     %% Do the old code check, then purge, and redo
 1235:     {T1,{ok,PurgeMods}} = timer:tc(release_handler_1,check_script,[S,[]]),
 1236:     true = (lists:sort(PurgeMods) == lists:sort(Modules)),
 1237:     [code:purge(M) || M <- PurgeMods],
 1238:     {T2,{ok,[]}} = timer:tc(release_handler_1,check_script,[S,[]]),
 1239: 
 1240:     %% Cleanup
 1241:     lists:foreach(fun(Pid) -> Pid ! stop end, Pids),
 1242:     lists:foreach(fun(Mod) -> code:purge(Mod),
 1243: 			      code:delete(Mod),
 1244: 			      code:purge(Mod)
 1245: 		  end, Modules),
 1246:     code:del_path(MPath),
 1247: 
 1248:     %% Test that second run was much faster than the first
 1249:     if T2 > 0 ->
 1250: 	    X = T1/T2,
 1251: 	    ct:log("~p procs, ~p mods -> ~n"
 1252: 		   "\tWith old code: ~.2f sec~n"
 1253: 		   "\tAfter purge: ~.2f sec~n"
 1254: 		   "\tT1/T2: ~.2f",
 1255: 		   [NProcs,length(Modules),T1/1000000,T2/1000000,X]),
 1256: 	    if X < 1 ->
 1257: 		    ct:fail({no_improvement_after_purge,X});
 1258: 	       true ->
 1259: 		    ok
 1260: 	    end;
 1261:        T1 > 0 -> %% Means T1/T2 = infinite
 1262: 	    ok;
 1263:        true ->
 1264: 	    ct:fail({unexpected_values,T1,T2})
 1265:     end,
 1266:     ok.
 1267: 
 1268: 
 1269: %% OTP-9395 - performance problems when there are MANY processes
 1270: %% Added option 'purge' to check_install_release
 1271: otp_9395_check_and_purge(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1272:     %% Set some paths
 1273:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 1274:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"otp_9395_check_and_purge"),
 1275:     LibDir = filename:join(?config(data_dir, Conf), "lib"),
 1276: 
 1277:     %% Create the releases
 1278:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,
 1279: 						 [{b,"1.0",LibDir}]),
 1280:     Rel2 = create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,
 1281: 				       "2",
 1282: 				       [{b,"2.0",LibDir}],
 1283: 				       {[Rel1],[Rel1],[LibDir]}),
 1284:     Rel1Dir = filename:dirname(Rel1),
 1285:     Rel2Dir = filename:dirname(Rel2),
 1286: 
 1287:     %% Start a slave node
 1288:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(otp_9395_check_and_purge, Rel1,
 1289: 			      filename:join(Rel1Dir,"sys.config")),
 1290: 
 1291:     %% Make sure there is old code for b_lib and b_server
 1292:     rpc:call(Node,code,load_file,[b_lib]),
 1293:     rpc:call(Node,code,load_file,[b_lib]),
 1294:     rpc:call(Node,code,load_file,[b_server]),
 1295:     rpc:call(Node,code,load_file,[b_server]),
 1296:     true = rpc:call(Node,erlang,check_old_code,[b_lib]),
 1297:     true = rpc:call(Node,erlang,check_old_code,[b_server]),
 1298: 
 1299:     %% Unpack second release, which removes b_lib module and loads b_server
 1300:     {ok, RelVsn2} =
 1301: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, set_unpacked,
 1302: 		 [Rel2++".rel", [{b,"2.0",LibDir}]]),
 1303:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1304: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "relup")]),
 1305:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1306: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "start.boot")]),
 1307:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1308: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "sys.config")]),
 1309: 
 1310:     %% Do check_install_release, and check that old code still exists
 1311:     {ok, _, []} =
 1312: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, check_install_release, [RelVsn2]),
 1313:     true = rpc:call(Node,erlang,check_old_code,[b_lib]),
 1314:     true = rpc:call(Node,erlang,check_old_code,[b_server]),
 1315: 
 1316:     %% Do check_install_release with option 'purge' and check that old
 1317:     %% code is gone
 1318:     {ok, _, []} =
 1319: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, check_install_release, [RelVsn2,[purge]]),
 1320:     false = rpc:call(Node,erlang,check_old_code,[b_lib]),
 1321:     false = rpc:call(Node,erlang,check_old_code,[b_server]),
 1322: 
 1323:     ok.
 1324: 
 1325: otp_9395_check_and_purge(cleanup,_Conf) ->
 1326:     stop_node(node_name(otp_9395_check_and_purge)).
 1327: 
 1328: 
 1329: %% OTP-9395 - performance problems when there are MANY processes
 1330: %% Upgrade which updates many modules (brutal_purge)
 1331: otp_9395_update_many_mods(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1332: 
 1333:     %% "nain" is very slow - it fails this test quite often due to a
 1334:     %% long sys call
 1335:     %% /proc/cpuinfo: "clock: 1249MHz"
 1336:     inet:gethostname() == {ok,"nain"} andalso throw({skip,"slow test host"}),
 1337: 
 1338:     %% Set some paths
 1339:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 1340:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"otp_9395_update_many_mods"),
 1341:     LibDir = filename:join(?config(data_dir, Conf), "lib"),
 1342: 
 1343:     %% Create the releases
 1344:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,
 1345: 						 [{many_mods,"1.0",LibDir}]),
 1346:     Rel2 = create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,
 1347: 				       "2",
 1348: 				       [{many_mods,"1.1",LibDir}],
 1349: 				       {[Rel1],[Rel1],[LibDir]}),
 1350:     Rel1Dir = filename:dirname(Rel1),
 1351:     Rel2Dir = filename:dirname(Rel2),
 1352: 
 1353:     %% Start a slave node
 1354:     PA = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1355:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(otp_9395_update_many_mods, Rel1,
 1356: 			      filename:join(Rel1Dir,"sys.config"), "-pa " ++ PA),
 1357: 
 1358:     %% Start a lot of processes on the new node, all with refs to each
 1359:     %% module that will be updated
 1360:     NProcs = 1000,
 1361:     {Modules,Pids1} = rpc:call(Node,m,start,[NProcs]),
 1362: 
 1363:     %% Then load modules in order to get old code
 1364:     [rpc:call(Node,code,load_file,[Mod]) || Mod <- Modules],
 1365:     true = rpc:call(Node,erlang,check_old_code,[m10]),
 1366: 
 1367:     %% Unpack second release, which updates all mX modules
 1368:     {ok, RelVsn2} =
 1369: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, set_unpacked,
 1370: 		 [Rel2++".rel", [{many_mods,"1.1",LibDir}]]),
 1371:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1372: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "relup")]),
 1373:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1374: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "start.boot")]),
 1375:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1376: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "sys.config")]),
 1377: 
 1378:     %% First, install release directly and check how much time it takes
 1379:     rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,garbage_collect,[]),
 1380:     SWTFlag0 = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, scheduler_wall_time, []),
 1381:     {TInst0,{ok, _, []}} =
 1382: 	timer:tc(rpc,call,[Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn2]]),
 1383:     SWT0 = rpc:call(Node,erlang,statistics,[scheduler_wall_time]),
 1384: %    ct:log("install_release: ~.2f",[TInst0/1000000]),
 1385: 
 1386:     %% Restore to old release, spawn processes again and load to get old code
 1387:     {_,RelVsn1} = init:script_id(),
 1388:     {_TInst1,{ok, _, []}} =
 1389: 	timer:tc(rpc,call,[Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn1]]),
 1390: %    ct:log("install_release: ~.2f",[_TInst1/1000000]),
 1391: 
 1392:     [exit(Pid,kill) || Pid <- Pids1],
 1393:     {Modules,_Pids2} = rpc:call(Node,m,start,[NProcs]),
 1394:     [rpc:call(Node,code,load_file,[Mod]) || Mod <- Modules],
 1395:     true = rpc:call(Node,erlang,check_old_code,[m10]),
 1396: 
 1397:     %% Run check_install_release with purge before install this time
 1398:     {_TCheck,{ok, _, []}} =
 1399: 	timer:tc(rpc,call,[Node, release_handler, check_install_release,
 1400: 			   [RelVsn2,[purge]]]),
 1401: %    ct:log("check_install_release with purge: ~.2f",[_TCheck/1000000]),
 1402: 
 1403:     %% Finally install release after check and purge, and check that
 1404:     %% this install was faster than the first.
 1405:     SWTFlag0 ! die,
 1406:     rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,garbage_collect,[]),
 1407:     _SWTFlag1 = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, scheduler_wall_time, []),
 1408:     {TInst2,{ok, _, []}} =
 1409: 	timer:tc(rpc,call,[Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn2]]),
 1410:     SWT2 = rpc:call(Node,erlang,statistics,[scheduler_wall_time]),
 1411: %    ct:log("install_release: ~.2f",[TInst2/1000000]),
 1412: 
 1413:     %% Calculate and print real time and CPU utilization
 1414:     SumFun = fun({_,A,T},{AAcc,TAcc}) -> {A+AAcc,T+TAcc} end,
 1415:     {SumA0,SumT0} = lists:foldl(SumFun,{0,0},SWT0),
 1416:     {SumA2,SumT2} = lists:foldl(SumFun,{0,0},SWT2),
 1417:     TI0=TInst0/1000000,
 1418:     TI2=TInst2/1000000,
 1419:     CPU0=SumA0/SumT0,
 1420:     CPU2=SumA2/SumT2,
 1421:     X0 = TI0*CPU0,
 1422:     X2 = TI2*CPU2,
 1423:     ct:log("First run:  T=~.2fsec, CPU=~.2f, T*CPU=~.2f~n"
 1424: 	   "Second run: T=~.2fsec, CPU=~.2f, T*CPU=~.2f~n",
 1425: 	   [TI0, CPU0, X0, TI2, CPU2, X2]),
 1426: 
 1427:     true = (X2 =< X0),  % disregarding wait time for file access etc.
 1428: 
 1429:     ok.
 1430: 
 1431: scheduler_wall_time() ->
 1432:     erlang:system_flag(scheduler_wall_time,true),
 1433:     receive _Msg -> normal end.
 1434: 
 1435: garbage_collect() ->
 1436:     Pids = processes(),
 1437:     [erlang:garbage_collect(Pid) || Pid <- Pids].
 1438: 
 1439: 
 1440: otp_9395_update_many_mods(cleanup,_Conf) ->
 1441:     stop_node(node_name(otp_9395_update_many_mods)).
 1442: 
 1443: 
 1444: %% OTP-9395 - performance problems when there are MANY processes
 1445: %% Upgrade which removes many modules (brutal_purge)
 1446: otp_9395_rm_many_mods(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1447: 
 1448:     %% "nain" is very slow - it fails this test quite often due to a
 1449:     %% long sys call
 1450:     %% /proc/cpuinfo: "clock: 1249MHz"
 1451:     inet:gethostname() == {ok,"nain"} andalso throw({skip,"slow test host"}),
 1452: 
 1453:     %% Set some paths
 1454:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 1455:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"otp_9395_rm_many_mods"),
 1456:     LibDir = filename:join(?config(data_dir, Conf), "lib"),
 1457: 
 1458:     %% Create the releases
 1459:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,
 1460: 						 [{many_mods,"1.0",LibDir}]),
 1461:     Rel2 = create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,
 1462: 				       "2",
 1463: 				       [{many_mods,"2.0",LibDir}],
 1464: 				       {[Rel1],[Rel1],[LibDir]}),
 1465:     Rel1Dir = filename:dirname(Rel1),
 1466:     Rel2Dir = filename:dirname(Rel2),
 1467: 
 1468:     %% Start a slave node
 1469:     PA = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 1470:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(otp_9395_rm_many_mods, Rel1,
 1471: 			      filename:join(Rel1Dir,"sys.config"), "-pa " ++ PA),
 1472: 
 1473:     %% Start a lot of processes on the new node, all with refs to each
 1474:     %% module that will be updated
 1475:     NProcs = 1000,
 1476:     {Modules,Pids1} = rpc:call(Node,m,start,[NProcs]),
 1477: 
 1478:     %% Then load modules in order to get old code
 1479:     [rpc:call(Node,code,load_file,[Mod]) || Mod <- Modules],
 1480:     true = rpc:call(Node,erlang,check_old_code,[m10]),
 1481: 
 1482:     %% Unpack second release, which removes all mX modules
 1483:     {ok, RelVsn2} =
 1484: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, set_unpacked,
 1485: 		 [Rel2++".rel", [{many_mods,"2.0",LibDir}]]),
 1486:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1487: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "relup")]),
 1488:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1489: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "start.boot")]),
 1490:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1491: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "sys.config")]),
 1492: 
 1493:     %% First, install release directly and check how much time it takes
 1494:     rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,garbage_collect,[]),
 1495:     SWTFlag0 = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, scheduler_wall_time, []),
 1496:     {TInst0,{ok, _, []}} =
 1497: 	timer:tc(rpc,call,[Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn2]]),
 1498:     SWT0 = rpc:call(Node,erlang,statistics,[scheduler_wall_time]),
 1499: %    ct:log("install_release: ~.2f",[TInst0/1000000]),
 1500: 
 1501:     %% Restore to old release, spawn processes again and load to get old code
 1502:     {_,RelVsn1} = init:script_id(),
 1503:     {_TInst1,{ok, _, []}} =
 1504: 	timer:tc(rpc,call,[Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn1]]),
 1505: %    ct:log("install_release: ~.2f",[_TInst1/1000000]),
 1506: 
 1507:     [exit(Pid,kill) || Pid <- Pids1],
 1508:     {Modules,_Pids2} = rpc:call(Node,m,start,[NProcs]),
 1509:     [rpc:call(Node,code,load_file,[Mod]) || Mod <- Modules],
 1510:     true = rpc:call(Node,erlang,check_old_code,[m10]),
 1511: 
 1512:     %% Run check_install_release with purge before install this time
 1513:     {_TCheck,{ok, _, []}} =
 1514: 	timer:tc(rpc,call,[Node, release_handler, check_install_release,
 1515: 			   [RelVsn2,[purge]]]),
 1516: %    ct:log("check_install_release with purge: ~.2f",[_TCheck/1000000]),
 1517: 
 1518:     %% Finally install release after check and purge, and check that
 1519:     %% this install was faster than the first.
 1520:     SWTFlag0 ! die,
 1521:     rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,garbage_collect,[]),
 1522:     _SWTFlag1 = spawn_link(Node, ?MODULE, scheduler_wall_time, []),
 1523:     {TInst2,{ok, _, []}} =
 1524: 	timer:tc(rpc,call,[Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn2]]),
 1525:     SWT2 = rpc:call(Node,erlang,statistics,[scheduler_wall_time]),
 1526: %    ct:log("install_release: ~.2f",[TInst2/1000000]),
 1527: 
 1528:     %% Calculate and print real time and CPU utilization
 1529:     SumFun = fun({_,A,T},{AAcc,TAcc}) -> {A+AAcc,T+TAcc} end,
 1530:     {SumA0,SumT0} = lists:foldl(SumFun,{0,0},SWT0),
 1531:     {SumA2,SumT2} = lists:foldl(SumFun,{0,0},SWT2),
 1532:     TI0=TInst0/1000000,
 1533:     TI2=TInst2/1000000,
 1534:     CPU0=SumA0/SumT0,
 1535:     CPU2=SumA2/SumT2,
 1536:     X0 = TI0*CPU0,
 1537:     X2 = TI2*CPU2,
 1538:     ct:log("First run:  T=~.2fsec, CPU=~.2f, T*CPU=~.2f~n"
 1539: 	   "Second run: T=~.2fsec, CPU=~.2f, T*CPU=~.2f~n",
 1540: 	   [TI0, CPU0, X0, TI2, CPU2, X2]),
 1541: 
 1542:     true = (X2 =< X0),  % disregarding wait time for file access etc.
 1543: 
 1544:     ok.
 1545: 
 1546: otp_9395_rm_many_mods(cleanup,_Conf) ->
 1547:     stop_node(node_name(otp_9395_rm_many_mods)).
 1548: 
 1549: otp_9864(Conf) ->
 1550:     case os:type() of
 1551: 	{win32,_} ->
 1552: 	    {skip,"Testing handling of symlinks - skipped on windows"};
 1553: 	_ ->
 1554: 	    do_otp_9864(Conf)
 1555:     end.
 1556: do_otp_9864(Conf) ->
 1557:     %% Set some paths
 1558:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 1559:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"otp_9864"),
 1560:     RelDir = filename:join(?config(data_dir, Conf), "app1_app2"),
 1561: 
 1562:     %% Copy libs to priv_dir because remove_release will remove some
 1563:     %% of these again, and we don't want to remove anything from
 1564:     %% data_dir
 1565:     copy_tree(Conf,filename:join(RelDir, "lib1"),Dir),
 1566:     copy_tree(Conf,filename:join(RelDir, "lib2"),Dir),
 1567:     LibDir1 = filename:join(Dir, "lib1"),
 1568:     LibDir2 = filename:join(Dir, "lib2"),
 1569: 
 1570:     %% Create the releases
 1571:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,
 1572: 						 [{app1,"1.0",LibDir1},
 1573: 						  {app2,"1.0",LibDir1}]),
 1574:     Rel2 = create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,
 1575: 				       "2",
 1576: 				       [{app1,"2.0",LibDir2},
 1577: 					{app2,"1.0",LibDir2}],
 1578: 				       {[Rel1],[Rel1],[LibDir1]}),
 1579:     Rel1Dir = filename:dirname(Rel1),
 1580:     Rel2Dir = filename:dirname(Rel2),
 1581: 
 1582:     %% Start a slave node
 1583:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(otp_9864, Rel1, filename:join(Rel1Dir,"sys.config")),
 1584:     
 1585:     %% Unpack rel2 (make sure it does not work if an AppDir is bad)
 1586:     {ok, RelVsn2} =
 1587: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, set_unpacked,
 1588: 		 [Rel2++".rel", [{app1,"2.0",LibDir2}, {app2,"1.0",LibDir2}]]),
 1589:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1590: 			[RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "relup")]),
 1591:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1592: 			[RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "start.boot")]),
 1593:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1594: 			[RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "sys.config")]),
 1595: 
 1596:     %% Install RelVsn2
 1597:     {ok, RelVsn1, []} =
 1598: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn2]),
 1599: 
 1600:     %% Create a symlink inside release 2
 1601:     Releases2Dir = filename:join([Dir,"releases","2"]),
 1602:     Link = filename:join(Releases2Dir,"foo_symlink_dir"),
 1603:     file:make_symlink(Releases2Dir,Link),
 1604: 
 1605:     %% Back down to RelVsn1
 1606:     {ok, RelVsn1, []} =
 1607: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn1]),
 1608: 
 1609:     %% This will fail if symlinks are not handled
 1610:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, remove_release, [RelVsn2]),
 1611: 
 1612:     ok.
 1613: 
 1614: otp_9864(cleanup,_Conf) ->
 1615:     stop_node(node_name(otp_9864)).
 1616: 
 1617: 
 1618: upgrade_supervisor(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1619:     %% Set some paths
 1620:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 1621:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"upgrade_supervisor"),
 1622:     LibDir = filename:join(?config(data_dir, Conf), "lib"),
 1623: 
 1624:     %% Create the releases
 1625:     Lib1 = [{a,"1.0",LibDir}],
 1626:     Lib2 = [{a,"9.0",LibDir}],
 1627:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,Lib1),
 1628:     Rel2 = create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,"2",Lib2,{[Rel1],[Rel1],[LibDir]}),
 1629:     Rel1Dir = filename:dirname(Rel1),
 1630:     Rel2Dir = filename:dirname(Rel2),
 1631: 
 1632:     %% Start a slave node
 1633:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(upgrade_supervisor, Rel1,
 1634: 			      filename:join(Rel1Dir,"sys.config")),
 1635: 
 1636:     %% Check path
 1637:     Dir1 = filename:join([LibDir, "a-1.0"]),
 1638:     Dir1 = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [a]),
 1639:     ASupBeam1 = filename:join([Dir1,ebin,"a_sup.beam"]),
 1640:     ASupBeam1 = rpc:call(Node, code, which, [a_sup]),
 1641: 
 1642:     %% Install second release, with no changed modules
 1643:     {ok, RelVsn2} = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, set_unpacked,
 1644: 			     [Rel2++".rel", Lib2]),
 1645:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1646: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "relup")]),
 1647:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1648: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "start.boot")]),
 1649:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1650: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "sys.config")]),
 1651: 
 1652:     {ok, _RelVsn1, []} =
 1653: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn2]),
 1654: 
 1655:     %% Check that libdir is changed
 1656:     Dir2 = filename:join([LibDir, "a-9.0"]),
 1657:     Dir2 = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [a]),
 1658:     ASupBeam2 = filename:join([Dir2,ebin,"a_sup.beam"]),
 1659:     ASupBeam2 = rpc:call(Node, code, which, [a_sup]),
 1660: 
 1661:     %% Check that the restart strategy and child spec is updated
 1662:     {status, _, {module, _}, [_, _, _, _, [_,_,{data,[{"State",State}]}|_]]} =
 1663: 	rpc:call(Node,sys,get_status,[a_sup]),
 1664:     {state,_,RestartStrategy,{[a],Db},_,_,_,_,_,_,_,_} = State,
 1665:     one_for_all = RestartStrategy, % changed from one_for_one
 1666:     {child,_,_,_,_,_,brutal_kill,_,_} = maps:get(a,Db), % changed from timeout 2000
 1667: 
 1668:     ok.
 1669: 
 1670: upgrade_supervisor(cleanup,_Condf) ->
 1671:     stop_node(node_name(upgrade_supervisor)).
 1672: 
 1673: %% Check that if the supervisor fails, then the upgrade is rolled back
 1674: %% and an ok error message is returned
 1675: upgrade_supervisor_fail(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1676:     %% Set some paths
 1677:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 1678:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"upgrade_supervisor_fail"),
 1679:     LibDir = filename:join(?config(data_dir, Conf), "lib"),
 1680: 
 1681:     %% Create the releases
 1682:     Lib1 = [{a,"1.0",LibDir}],
 1683:     Lib2 = [{a,"9.1",LibDir}],
 1684:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,Lib1),
 1685:     Rel2 = create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,"2",Lib2,{[Rel1],[Rel1],[LibDir]}),
 1686:     Rel1Dir = filename:dirname(Rel1),
 1687:     Rel2Dir = filename:dirname(Rel2),
 1688: 
 1689:     %% Start a slave node
 1690:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(upgrade_supervisor_fail, Rel1,
 1691: 			      filename:join(Rel1Dir,"sys.config")),
 1692: 
 1693:     %% Check path
 1694:     Dir1 = filename:join([LibDir, "a-1.0"]),
 1695:     Dir1 = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [a]),
 1696:     ASupBeam1 = filename:join([Dir1,ebin,"a_sup.beam"]),
 1697:     ASupBeam1 = rpc:call(Node, code, which, [a_sup]),
 1698: 
 1699:     %% Install second release, with no changed modules
 1700:     {ok, RelVsn2} = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, set_unpacked,
 1701: 			     [Rel2++".rel", Lib2]),
 1702:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1703: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "relup")]),
 1704:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1705: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "start.boot")]),
 1706:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 1707: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "sys.config")]),
 1708:     ok = net_kernel:monitor_nodes(true),
 1709: 
 1710:     {error,{code_change_failed,_Pid,a_sup,_Vsn,
 1711: 	    {error,{invalid_shutdown,brutal_kil}}}} =
 1712: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release,
 1713: 		 [RelVsn2, [{error_action,reboot}]]),
 1714: 
 1715:     %% Check that the upgrade is terminated - normally this would be a
 1716:     %% rollback, but
 1717:     %%
 1718:     %% 1. Default rollback is done with init:restart(), which does not
 1719:     %%    reboot the emulator, it only restarts the system inside the
 1720:     %%    running erlang node.
 1721:     %%
 1722:     %% 2. This does not work well on a slave node since, if timing is
 1723:     %%    right (bad), the slave node will get the nodedown from its
 1724:     %%    master (because distribution is terminated as part of
 1725:     %%    init:restart()) and then it will do halt() and thus never be
 1726:     %%    restarted (see slave:wloop/1)
 1727:     %%
 1728:     %% 3. Sometimes, though, init:restart() will manage to finish its
 1729:     %%    job before the nodedown is received, making the node
 1730:     %%    actually restart - in which case it might very well confuse
 1731:     %%    the next test case.
 1732:     %%
 1733:     %% 4. So, to avoid unstability we use {error_action,reboot} above,
 1734:     %%    to ensure that the node is actually stopped. Of course, in a
 1735:     %%    real system this must be used together with heart
 1736:     %%    supervision, and then the node will be restarted anyway. But
 1737:     %%    here in this simple test case we are satisfied to see that
 1738:     %%    the node terminates.
 1739:     receive {nodedown,Node} -> ok
 1740:     after 10000 -> ct:fail(failed_upgrade_never_restarted_node)
 1741:     end,
 1742: 
 1743:     ok.
 1744: 
 1745: upgrade_supervisor_fail(cleanup,_Condf) ->
 1746:     stop_node(node_name(upgrade_supervisor_fail)).
 1747: 
 1748: %% Test upgrade and downgrade of applications
 1749: eval_appup(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1750: 
 1751:     %% OTP-6162
 1752:     %% Create an ETS table which is updated by app1 if there is any
 1753:     %% change made to the application configuration parameter 'var'
 1754:     %% (see config_change/3 in myrel/lib1|2/app1-1|2.0/src/app1.erl)
 1755:     ets:new(otp_6162, [set, public, named_table]),
 1756: 
 1757:     %% Set some paths
 1758:     RelDir = filename:join(?config(data_dir, Conf), "app1_app2"),
 1759:     App11Dir = filename:join([RelDir, "lib1", "app1-1.0"]),
 1760:     App12Dir = filename:join([RelDir, "lib2", "app1-2.0"]),
 1761:     EbinDir = filename:join(App11Dir, "ebin"),
 1762: 
 1763:     %% Start app1-1.0
 1764:     code:add_patha(EbinDir),
 1765:     ok = application:start(app1),
 1766:     App11Dir = code:lib_dir(app1),
 1767:     ok = gen_server:call(harry, error),
 1768: 
 1769:     %% Read appup script
 1770:     {ok,"2.0",UpScript} = release_handler:upgrade_script(app1,App12Dir),
 1771:     [{load_object_code,_},
 1772:      point_of_no_return,
 1773:      {load,_}] = UpScript,
 1774: 
 1775:     %% Upgrade to app1-2.0
 1776:     {ok, []} = release_handler:upgrade_app(app1, App12Dir),
 1777:     App12Dir = code:lib_dir(app1),
 1778:     error = gen_server:call(harry, error),
 1779: 
 1780:     %% OTP-6162
 1781:     %% Value of config parameter 'var' should now be 'val2'
 1782:     %% (see myrel/lib2/app1-2.0/ebin/app1.app)
 1783:     [{var,val2}] = ets:lookup(otp_6162, var),
 1784: 
 1785:     %% Read appup script
 1786:     {ok,DnScript} = release_handler:downgrade_script(app1,"1.0",App11Dir),
 1787:     [{load_object_code,_},
 1788:      point_of_no_return,
 1789:      {load,_}] = DnScript,
 1790: 
 1791:     %% Downgrade to app1-1.0
 1792:     {ok, []} = release_handler:downgrade_app(app1,"1.0",App11Dir),
 1793:     App11Dir = code:lib_dir(app1),
 1794:     ok = gen_server:call(harry, error),
 1795: 
 1796:     %% OTP-6162
 1797:     %% Value of config parameter 'var' should now be 'val1'
 1798:     %% (see myrel/lib1/app1-1.0/ebin/app1.app)
 1799:     [{var,val1}] = ets:lookup(otp_6162, var),
 1800: 
 1801:     ok = application:stop(app1),
 1802:     ok = application:unload(app1),
 1803: 
 1804:     true = code:del_path(EbinDir),
 1805:     ok.
 1806: 
 1807: 
 1808: %% Test upgrade and downgrade of applications when appup contains
 1809: %% restart_emulator and restart_new_emulator instructions
 1810: eval_appup_with_restart(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1811: 
 1812:     %% Set some paths
 1813:     RelDir = filename:join(?config(data_dir, Conf), "app1_app2"),
 1814:     App11Dir = filename:join([RelDir, "lib1", "app1-1.0"]),
 1815:     App13Dir = filename:join([RelDir, "lib3", "app1-3.0"]), %restart_emulator
 1816:     App14Dir = filename:join([RelDir, "lib4", "app1-4.0"]), %restart_new_emulator
 1817:     EbinDir1 = filename:join(App11Dir, "ebin"),
 1818:     EbinDir3 = filename:join(App13Dir, "ebin"),
 1819:     EbinDir4 = filename:join(App14Dir, "ebin"),
 1820: 
 1821:     %% Start app1-1.0
 1822:     code:add_patha(EbinDir1),
 1823:     ok = application:start(app1),
 1824:     App11Dir = code:lib_dir(app1),
 1825: 
 1826:     %% Read appup script
 1827:     {ok,"3.0",UpScript3} = release_handler:upgrade_script(app1,App13Dir),
 1828:     [{load_object_code,_},
 1829:      point_of_no_return,
 1830:      {load,_},
 1831:      restart_emulator] = UpScript3,
 1832: 
 1833:     %% Upgrade to app1-3.0 - restart_emulator
 1834:     restart_emulator = release_handler:upgrade_app(app1, App13Dir),
 1835:     App13Dir = code:lib_dir(app1),
 1836: 
 1837:     %% Fake full upgrade to 3.0
 1838:     {ok,AppSpec} = file:consult(filename:join([App13Dir,"ebin","app1.app"])),
 1839:     application_controller:change_application_data(AppSpec,[]),
 1840: 
 1841:     %% Read appup script
 1842:     {ok,"4.0",UpScript4} = release_handler:upgrade_script(app1,App14Dir),
 1843:     [restart_new_emulator,point_of_no_return] = UpScript4,
 1844: 
 1845:     %% Try pgrade to app1-4.0 - restart_new_emulator
 1846:     {error,restart_new_emulator} = release_handler:upgrade_app(app1, App14Dir),
 1847:     App13Dir = code:lib_dir(app1),
 1848: 
 1849:     %% Read appup script
 1850:     {ok,DnScript1} = release_handler:downgrade_script(app1,"1.0",App11Dir),
 1851:     [{load_object_code,_},
 1852:      point_of_no_return,
 1853:      {load,_},
 1854:      restart_emulator] = DnScript1,
 1855: 
 1856:     %% Still running 3.0 - downgrade to app1-1.0 - restart_emulator
 1857:     restart_emulator = release_handler:downgrade_app(app1,"1.0",App11Dir),
 1858:     App11Dir = code:lib_dir(app1),
 1859: 
 1860:     ok = application:stop(app1),
