 1861:     ok = application:unload(app1),
 1862:     true = code:del_path(EbinDir1),
 1863: 
 1864:     %% Start again as version 4.0
 1865:     code:add_patha(EbinDir4),
 1866:     ok = application:start(app1),
 1867:     App14Dir = code:lib_dir(app1),
 1868: 
 1869:     %% Read appup script
 1870:     {ok,DnScript3} = release_handler:downgrade_script(app1,"3.0",App13Dir),
 1871:     [point_of_no_return,restart_emulator] = DnScript3,
 1872: 
 1873:     %% Downgrade to app1-3.0 - restart_new_emulator
 1874:     restart_emulator = release_handler:downgrade_app(app1,"3.0",App13Dir),
 1875:     App13Dir = code:lib_dir(app1),
 1876: 
 1877:     ok = application:stop(app1),
 1878:     ok = application:unload(app1),
 1879: 
 1880:     true = code:del_path(EbinDir3),
 1881:     false = code:del_path(EbinDir1),
 1882:     false = code:del_path(EbinDir4),
 1883: 
 1884:     ok.
 1885: 
 1886: 
 1887: %% Test the example/target_system.erl module
 1888: target_system(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 1889:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 1890:     target_system1(Conf,PrivDir).
 1891: 
 1892: target_system1(Conf,PrivDir) ->
 1893:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Conf),
 1894: 
 1895:     TargetCreateDir = filename:join([PrivDir,"target_system","create"]),
 1896:     TargetInstallDir = filename:join([PrivDir,"target_system","install"]),
 1897: 
 1898:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(TargetCreateDir,"xx")),
 1899:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(TargetInstallDir,"xx")),
 1900: 
 1901:     %% Create the .rel file
 1902:     RelName = filename:join(TargetCreateDir,"ts-1.0"),
 1903:     RelFile = RelName++".rel",
 1904:     RelVsn = "R1A",
 1905:     create_rel_file(RelFile,RelName,RelVsn,current,[{a, "1.0"}]),
 1906: 
 1907:     %% Build the target_system module
 1908:     ExamplesEbin = filename:join([code:lib_dir(sasl),examples,ebin]),
 1909:     TSPath =
 1910: 	case filelib:is_file(filename:join(ExamplesEbin,"target_system.beam")) of
 1911: 	    true ->
 1912: 		ExamplesEbin;
 1913: 	    false ->
 1914: 		{ok,_} =
 1915: 		    compile:file(filename:join(DataDir,"target_system.erl"),
 1916: 				 [{outdir,TargetCreateDir}]),
 1917: 		TargetCreateDir
 1918:     end,
 1919:     code:add_path(TSPath),
 1920: 
 1921:     %% Create the release
 1922:     target_system:create(RelName,[{path,[filename:join([DataDir,
 1923: 							lib,
 1924: 							"a-1.0",
 1925: 							ebin])]}]),
 1926: 
 1927:     %% Install the release
 1928:     target_system:install(RelName,TargetInstallDir),
 1929: 
 1930:     code:del_path(TSPath),
 1931: 
 1932:     %% Check that all files exist in installation
 1933:     ErtsDir = app_dir(erts,current),
 1934:     true = filelib:is_dir(filename:join(TargetInstallDir,ErtsDir)),
 1935:     LibDir = filename:join(TargetInstallDir,lib),
 1936:     KernelVsn = vsn(kernel,current),
 1937:     StdlibVsn = vsn(stdlib,current),
 1938:     SaslVsn = vsn(sasl,current),
 1939:     RelFileBasename = filename:basename(RelFile),
 1940:     KernelLibDir = filename:join(LibDir,"kernel-"++KernelVsn),
 1941:     true = filelib:is_dir(KernelLibDir),
 1942:     true = filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir,"stdlib-"++StdlibVsn)),
 1943:     true = filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir,"sasl-"++SaslVsn)),
 1944:     true = filelib:is_dir(filename:join(LibDir,"a-1.0")),
 1945:     RelDir = filename:join(TargetInstallDir,releases),
 1946:     true = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(RelDir,"RELEASES")),
 1947:     true = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(RelDir,"start_erl.data")),
 1948:     true = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(RelDir,RelFileBasename)),
 1949:     true = filelib:is_dir(filename:join(RelDir,RelVsn)),
 1950:     StartBoot = filename:join([RelDir,RelVsn,"start.boot"]),
 1951:     true = filelib:is_regular(StartBoot),
 1952:     true = filelib:is_regular(filename:join([RelDir,RelVsn,RelFileBasename])),
 1953:     BinDir = filename:join(TargetInstallDir,bin),
 1954:     Erl = filename:join(BinDir,erl),
 1955:     true = filelib:is_regular(Erl),
 1956:     true = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(BinDir,"start.boot")),
 1957:     true = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(BinDir,start_erl)),
 1958:     true = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(BinDir,start)),
 1959:     true = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(BinDir,epmd)),
 1960:     true = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(BinDir,run_erl)),
 1961:     true = filelib:is_regular(filename:join(BinDir,to_erl)),
 1962: 
 1963:     %% Check content of files
 1964:     ErtsVsn = vsn(erts,current),
 1965:     {ok,SED} = file:read_file(filename:join(RelDir,"start_erl.data")),
 1966:     [ErtsVsn,RelVsn] = string:tokens(binary_to_list(SED),"\s\n"),
 1967: 
 1968:     %% Check that installation can be started
 1969:     Sname = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "-target_system"),
 1970:     {ok,Node} = start_target_node_with_erl(Erl,Sname,StartBoot),
 1971: 
 1972:     TargetInstallDir = rpc:call(Node,code,root_dir,[]),
 1973:     KernelLibDir = rpc:call(Node,code,lib_dir,[kernel]),
 1974:     [{RelName,RelVsn,_Apps,permanent}] =
 1975: 	rpc:call(Node,release_handler,which_releases,[]),
 1976: 
 1977:     test_server:format("Target node ok:~nRootDir: ~ts~nKernelLibDir: ~ts~nRelease: ~ts",
 1978: 	      [TargetInstallDir,KernelLibDir,RelName]),
 1979: 
 1980:     ok.
 1981: 
 1982: target_system(cleanup,_Conf) ->
 1983:     Sname = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "-target_system"),
 1984:     stop_target_node(node_name(Sname)),
 1985:     ok.
 1986: 
 1987: start_target_node_with_erl(Erl,Sname,Boot) ->
 1988:     FullName = node_name(Sname),
 1989:     FilenameMode = case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1990: 		       latin1 -> "+fnl";
 1991: 		       utf8 -> "+fnui"
 1992: 		   end,
 1993:     Args = [FilenameMode,"-detached", "-noinput","-sname",atom_to_list(Sname),
 1994: 	   "-boot",filename:rootname(Boot)],
 1995:     test_server:format("Starting node ~p: ~ts~n",
 1996: 	      [FullName, lists:flatten([[X," "] || X <- [Erl|Args]])]),
 1997:     case rh_test_lib:cmd(Erl,Args,[]) of
 1998: 	ok ->
 1999: 	    ok = wait_nodes_up([FullName],"target_system test node"),
 2000: 	    {ok,FullName};
 2001: 	Error ->
 2002:             ct:fail({failed_to_start_node, FullName, Error})
 2003:     end.
 2004: 
 2005: stop_target_node(Node) ->
 2006:     monitor_node(Node, true),
 2007:     _ = rpc:call(Node,erlang,halt,[]),
 2008:     receive {nodedown, Node} -> ok end.
 2009: 
 2010: %% Test that the example/target_system.erl module can create and
 2011: %% install under a path which includes unicode characters
 2012: target_system_unicode(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 2013:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 2014:     UnicodePrivDir = filename:join(PrivDir,""),
 2015: 
 2016:     PA = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
 2017: 
 2018:     %% Make sure this runs on a node with unicode file name mode
 2019:     Sname = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "-target_system_unicode"),
 2020:     {ok,Node} = test_server:start_node(Sname,peer,[{args,"+fnui -pa " ++ PA}]),
 2021:     ok = rpc:call(Node,file,make_dir,[UnicodePrivDir]),
 2022:     case rpc:call(Node,application,start,[sasl]) of
 2023: 	ok -> ok;
 2024: 	{error,{already_started,sasl}} -> ok;
 2025: 	Error -> ct:fail({failed_to_start_sasl_on_test_node,Node,Error})
 2026:     end,
 2027:     ok = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,target_system1,[Conf,UnicodePrivDir]),
 2028:     ok.
 2029: 
 2030: target_system_unicode(cleanup,Conf) ->
 2031:     Sname = list_to_atom(atom_to_list(?MODULE) ++ "-target_system_unicode"),
 2032:     Node = node_name(Sname),
 2033:     _ = rpc:call(Node,?MODULE,target_system,[cleanup,Conf]),
 2034:     _ = stop_node(Node),
 2035:     ok.
 2036: 
 2037: %%%=================================================================
 2038: %%% Testing global groups.
 2039: %%%=================================================================
 2040: 
 2041: %% This test case involves P1G and P1H with the sys.config as
 2042: %% specified in gg_config/1. The test case checks that the global
 2043: %% group information is correct before and after the upgrade and also
 2044: %% after terminating one of the nodes. The flow is as follows:
 2045: %% 1. Start all four nodes of global group gg1 with P1G
 2046: %% 2. Terminate one of the nodes, and upgrade the others to P1H. P1H
 2047: %%    config adds to more nodes to the global group.
 2048: %% 3. Start the two remaining nodes with P1H
 2049: upgrade_gg(Conf) ->
 2050:     [Gg1Sname,Gg2Sname,Gg3Sname,Gg4Sname,Gg5Sname,Gg6Sname] =
 2051: 	?config(snames,Conf),
 2052: 
 2053:     %% start gg1, gg3, gg4, gg5 and check that global group info is ok
 2054:     Nodes1 = [Gg1,Gg3,Gg4,Gg5] =
 2055: 	start_nodes(Conf,[Gg1Sname,Gg3Sname,Gg4Sname,Gg5Sname],"upgrade_gg"),
 2056: 
 2057:     [check_gg_info(Node,Nodes1,[],Nodes1--[Node]) || Node <- Nodes1],
 2058: 
 2059:     %% register a process on each of the nodes
 2060:     ok = rpc:call(Gg1, installer, reg_proc, [reg1]),
 2061:     ok = rpc:call(Gg3, installer, reg_proc, [reg3]),
 2062:     ok = rpc:call(Gg4, installer, reg_proc, [reg4]),
 2063:     ok = rpc:call(Gg5, installer, reg_proc, [reg5]),
 2064:     are_names_reg_gg(Gg1, [reg1, reg3, reg4, reg5]),
 2065: 
 2066:     %% Stop gg3, then upgrade gg1, gg4 and gg5 to P1H
 2067:     ok = stop_nodes([Gg3]),
 2068: 
 2069:     ok = install_release_changed_gg(Gg1,"P1H"),
 2070:     ok = install_release_changed_gg(Gg4,"P1H"),
 2071:     ok = install_release_changed_gg(Gg5,"P1H"),
 2072: 
 2073:     %% Check global group info
 2074:     Gg2 = node_name(Gg2Sname),
 2075:     Gg6 = node_name(Gg6Sname),
 2076:     Nodes2 = [Gg1,Gg4,Gg5],
 2077:     [check_gg_info(Node,Nodes2,[Gg2,Gg6],Nodes2--[Node]) || Node <- Nodes2],
 2078: 
 2079:     %% start gg2 and gg6
 2080:     [Gg2,Gg6] = start_nodes(Conf,[Gg2Sname,Gg6Sname],"upgrade_gg start gg2/gg6"),
 2081: 
 2082:     %% Watch dog pulling out some more information in case we hang...
 2083:     Nodes3 = [Gg1,Gg2,Gg4,Gg5,Gg6],
 2084:     Tester = self(),
 2085:     WD = spawn_link(fun () ->
 2086:                             receive after 7*60*1000 -> ok end,
 2087:                             ct:pal("7 minutes passed...~n", []),
 2088:                             erlang:suspend_process(Tester),
 2089:                             load_suite(Nodes3),
 2090:                             dump_info([node()|Nodes3]),
 2091:                             exit(operation_hang)
 2092:                     end),
 2093: 
 2094:     %% reg proc on each of the nodes
 2095:     ok = rpc:call(Gg2, installer, reg_proc, [reg2]),
 2096:     ok = rpc:call(Gg6, installer, reg_proc, [reg6]),
 2097: 
 2098:     %% Check global group info
 2099:     [check_gg_info(Node,Nodes3,[],Nodes3--[Node]) || Node <- Nodes3],
 2100: 
 2101:     OkList = lists:map(fun (_) -> ok end, Nodes3),
 2102:     {OkList,[]} = rpc:multicall(Nodes3, global, sync, []),
 2103: 
 2104:     are_names_reg_gg(Gg1, [reg1, reg2, reg4, reg5, reg6]),
 2105: 
 2106:     unlink(WD),
 2107:     exit(WD, kill),
 2108:     false = is_process_alive(WD),
 2109: 
 2110:     ok.
 2111: 
 2112: upgrade_gg(cleanup,Config) ->
 2113:     Snames = ?config(snames,Config),
 2114:     NodeNames = [node_name(Sname) || Sname <- Snames],
 2115:     ok = stop_nodes(NodeNames).
 2116: 
 2117: load_suite(Nodes) ->
 2118:     {ok,Bin}=file:read_file(code:which(?MODULE)),
 2119:     _ = rpc:multicall(Nodes, erlang, load_module, [?MODULE, Bin]),
 2120:     ok.
 2121: 
 2122: dump_info(Nodes) ->
 2123:     GetLockerState = fun (TheLocker) ->
 2124:                              Mon = erlang:monitor(process, TheLocker),
 2125:                              TheLocker ! {get_state, self(), Mon},
 2126:                              receive
 2127:                                  Msg when element(1, Msg) =:= Mon ->
 2128:                                      erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]),
 2129:                                      RList = tl(erlang:tuple_to_list(Msg)),
 2130:                                      erlang:list_to_tuple([state | RList]);
 2131:                                  {'DOWN', Mon, process, TheLocker, Reason} ->
 2132:                                      {error, Reason}
 2133:                              after 60*1000 ->
 2134:                                      erlang:demonitor(Mon, [flush]),
 2135:                                      {error, timeout}
 2136:                              end
 2137:                      end,
 2138:     GI = rpc:multicall(Nodes,
 2139:                        erlang,
 2140:                        apply,
 2141:                        [fun () ->
 2142:                                 GlobalLocker = global:get_locker(),
 2143:                                 {node(),
 2144:                                  #{global_state => global:info(),
 2145:                                    global_dict => process_info(whereis(global_name_server), dictionary),
 2146:                                    global_locks_tab => ets:tab2list(global_locks),
 2147:                                    global_names_tab => ets:tab2list(global_names),
 2148:                                    global_names_ext_tab => ets:tab2list(global_names_ext),
 2149:                                    global_pid_names_tab => ets:tab2list(global_pid_names),
 2150:                                    global_pid_ids_tab => ets:tab2list(global_pid_ids),
 2151:                                    global_lost_connections_tab => ets:tab2list(global_lost_connections),
 2152:                                    global_node_resources_tag => ets:tab2list(global_node_resources),
 2153:                                    global_locker_state => GetLockerState(GlobalLocker),
 2154:                                    global_locker_info => process_info(GlobalLocker,
 2155:                                                                       [status,
 2156:                                                                        current_stacktrace,
 2157:                                                                        messages,
 2158:                                                                        dictionary]),
 2159:                                    global_group_info => global_group:info()}}
 2160:                         end,
 2161:                         []],
 2162:                        2*60*1000),
 2163:     ct:pal("GI: ~p~n", [GI]).
 2164: 
 2165: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2166: %%% OTP-10463, Bug - release_handler could not handle regexp in appup
 2167: %%% files.
 2168: otp_10463_upgrade_script_regexp(Config) ->
 2169:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Config),
 2170:     code:add_path(filename:join([DataDir,regexp_appup,app1,ebin])),
 2171:     application:start(app1),
 2172:     {ok,"1.1",_} = release_handler:upgrade_script(app1,code:lib_dir(app1)),
 2173:     ok.
 2174: 
 2175: otp_10463_upgrade_script_regexp(cleanup,Config) ->
 2176:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Config),
 2177:     application:stop(app1),
 2178:     code:del_path(filename:join([DataDir,regexp_appup,app1,ebin])),
 2179:     ok.
 2180: 
 2181: no_dot_erlang(Conf) ->
 2182:     case {os:type(),init:get_argument(home)} of
 2183:         {{unix,_},_} ->
 2184:             %% On unix we set HOME to priv_dir so that we
 2185:             %% do not have to change the users ~/.erlang
 2186:             Home = ?config(priv_dir, Conf),
 2187:             no_dot_erlang_1("HOME=\""++ Home ++"\" ",Home);
 2188:         {{win32,_},{ok,[[Home]]}} when is_list(Home) ->
 2189:             no_dot_erlang_1("",Home);
 2190:         _ -> {skip,"Could not find home directory"}
 2191:     end.
 2192: 
 2193: no_dot_erlang_1(Prefix, Home) ->
 2194:     DotErlang = filename:join(Home, ".erlang"),
 2195:     BupErlang = filename:join(Home, ".erlang_testbup"),
 2196:     try
 2197:         {ok, Wd} = file:get_cwd(),
 2198:         case filelib:is_file(DotErlang) of
 2199:             true -> {ok, _} = file:copy(DotErlang, BupErlang);
 2200:             false -> ok
 2201:         end,
 2202: 	Erl0 =  filename:join([code:root_dir(),"bin","erl"]),
 2203: 	Erl = filename:nativename(Erl0),
 2204: 	Quote = "\"",
 2205: 	Args = " -noinput -run c pwd -run erlang halt",
 2206: 	ok = file:write_file(DotErlang, <<"io:put_chars(\"DOT_ERLANG_READ\\n\").\n">>),
 2207: 
 2208: 	CMD1 = Prefix ++ Quote ++ Erl ++ Quote ++ Args ,
 2209: 	case os:cmd(CMD1) of
 2210: 	    "DOT_ERLANG_READ" ++ _ ->
 2211:                 io:format("~p: Success~n", [?LINE]);
 2212: 	    Other1 ->
 2213: 		io:format("Failed: ~ts~n",[CMD1]),
 2214: 		io:format("Expected: ~s ++ _~n",["DOT_ERLANG_READ "]),
 2215: 		io:format("Got: ~ts~n",[Other1]),
 2216: 		exit({failed_to_start, test_error})
 2217: 	end,
 2218: 	NO_DOT_ERL = " -boot no_dot_erlang",
 2219: 	CMD2 = Prefix ++ Quote ++ Erl ++ Quote ++ NO_DOT_ERL ++ Args,
 2220: 	case lists:prefix(Wd, Other2 = os:cmd(CMD2)) of
 2221: 	    true -> io:format("~p: Success~n", [?LINE]);
 2222: 	    false ->
 2223: 		io:format("Failed: ~ts~n",[CMD2]),
 2224: 		io:format("Expected: ~s~n",["TESTOK"]),
 2225: 		io:format("Got: ~ts~n",[Other2]),
 2226: 		exit({failed_to_start, no_dot_erlang})
 2227: 	end
 2228:     after
 2229:         case filelib:is_file(BupErlang) of
 2230:             true ->
 2231:                 {ok, _} = file:copy(BupErlang, DotErlang),
 2232:                 _ = file:delete(BupErlang);
 2233:             false ->
 2234:                 _ = file:delete(DotErlang)
 2235:         end
 2236:     end.
 2237: 
 2238: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 2239: %%% Test unicode handling. Make sure that release name, application
 2240: %%% description, and application environment variables may contain
 2241: %%% unicode characters.
 2242: unicode_upgrade(Conf) ->
 2243:     %% Set some paths
 2244:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Conf),
 2245:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 2246:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir,"unicode"),
 2247:     LibDir0 = filename:join(DataDir, "unicode"),
 2248:     LibDir =
 2249:         case {file:native_name_encoding(),os:type()} of
 2250:             {utf8,{Os,_}} when Os =/= win32 ->
 2251:                 LD = filename:join(DataDir,"unicode_"),
 2252:                 file:make_symlink("unicode",LD),
 2253:                 LD;
 2254:             _ ->
 2255:                 LibDir0
 2256:         end,
 2257: 
 2258:     %% Create the releases
 2259:     RelName = "unicode_rel_",
 2260:     Rel1 = create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,{RelName,"1"},
 2261: 						 [{u,"1.0",LibDir}]),
 2262:     Rel2 = create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,
 2263: 				       {RelName,"2"},
 2264: 				       [{u,"1.1",LibDir}],
 2265: 				       {[Rel1],[Rel1],[LibDir]}),
 2266:     Rel1Dir = filename:dirname(Rel1),
 2267:     Rel2Dir = filename:dirname(Rel2),
 2268: 
 2269:     %% Start a slave node
 2270:     {ok, Node} = t_start_node(unicode_upgrade, Rel1,
 2271:                               filename:join(Rel1Dir,"sys.config"), "+pc unicode"),
 2272: 
 2273:     %% Check
 2274:     Dir1 = filename:join([LibDir, "u-1.0"]),
 2275:     Dir1 = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [u]),
 2276:     UBeam1 = filename:join([Dir1,"ebin","u.beam"]),
 2277:     UBeam1 = rpc:call(Node,code,which,[u]),
 2278:     {RelName,"1"} = rpc:call(Node,init,script_id,[]),
 2279:     {Env,state} = rpc:call(Node,u,u,[]),
 2280:     'val_' = proplists:get_value('key_',Env),
 2281:     [{RelName,"1",_,permanent}|_] =
 2282:         rpc:call(Node,release_handler,which_releases,[]),
 2283:     {ok,ReleasesDir} = rpc:call(Node,application,get_env,[sasl,releases_dir]),
 2284:     {ok,[[{release,RelName,"1",_,_,permanent}|_]]} =
 2285:         file:consult(filename:join(ReleasesDir,"RELEASES")),
 2286: 
 2287:     %% Install second release
 2288:     {ok, RelVsn2} =
 2289: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, set_unpacked,
 2290: 		 [Rel2++".rel", [{u,"1.1",LibDir}]]),
 2291:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 2292: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "relup")]),
 2293:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 2294: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "start.boot")]),
 2295:     ok = rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_file,
 2296: 		  [RelVsn2, filename:join(Rel2Dir, "sys.config")]),
 2297: 
 2298:     {ok, _RelVsn1, []} =
 2299: 	rpc:call(Node, release_handler, install_release, [RelVsn2]),
 2300: 
 2301:     %% And check
 2302:     Dir2 = filename:join([LibDir, "u-1.1"]),
 2303:     Dir2 = rpc:call(Node, code, lib_dir, [u]),
 2304:     UBeam2 = filename:join([Dir2,"ebin","u.beam"]),
 2305:     {file,UBeam2} = rpc:call(Node,code,is_loaded,[u]),
 2306:     {RelName,"1"} = rpc:call(Node,init,script_id,[]),
 2307:     {Env,{state,''}} = rpc:call(Node,u,u,[]),
 2308:     [{RelName,"2",_,current}|_] =
 2309:         rpc:call(Node,release_handler,which_releases,[]),
 2310:     {ok,ReleasesDir2} = rpc:call(Node,application,get_env,[sasl,releases_dir]),
 2311:     {ok,<<"%% coding: utf-8\n[{release,\"unicode_rel_\",\"2\""/utf8,_/binary>>}=
 2312:         file:read_file(filename:join(ReleasesDir2,"RELEASES")),
 2313:     ok.
 2314: 
 2315: unicode_upgrade(cleanup,_Conf) ->
 2316:     stop_node(node_name(unicode_upgrade)).
 2317: 
 2318: 
 2319: %%%=================================================================
 2320: %%% Misceleaneous functions
 2321: %%%=================================================================
 2322: stop_nodes(Nodes) ->
 2323:     test_server:format("Stopping nodes: ~p~n",[Nodes]),
 2324:     Running = 
 2325: 	lists:foldl(fun(Node,Acc) -> 
 2326: 			    Now = now(),
 2327: 			    stop_cover(Node),
 2328: 			    case rpc:call(Node,installer,stop,[Now]) of
 2329: 				{badrpc,nodedown} ->
 2330: 				    Acc;
 2331: 				Other ->
 2332: 				    test_server:format("Stop ~p(~p): ~p~n",
 2333: 					      [Node,Now,Other]),
 2334: 				    [Node|Acc]
 2335: 			    end
 2336: 		    end, [], Nodes),
 2337:     wait_nodes_down(Running).
 2338: 
 2339: 
 2340: wait_nodes_down(Nodes) ->
 2341:     test_server:format( "wait_nodes_down ~p:",[Nodes]),
 2342:     wait_nodes_down(Nodes, 30).
 2343: 
 2344: wait_nodes_down(Nodes, 0) ->
 2345:     ct:fail({error, {"could not kill nodes", Nodes}});
 2346: wait_nodes_down(Nodes, N) ->
 2347:     Fun = fun(Node, A) ->
 2348: 		  case net_adm:ping(Node) of
 2349: 		      pong ->
 2350: 			  test_server:format( "  net_adm:ping(~p) = pong", [Node]),
 2351: 			  [Node|A];
 2352: 		      pang ->
 2353: 			  test_server:format( "  net_adm:ping(~p) = pang", [Node]),
 2354: 			  A
 2355: 		  end
 2356: 	  end,
 2357:     Pang = lists:foldl(Fun, [], Nodes),
 2358:     case Pang of
 2359: 	[] -> 
 2360: 	    test_server:format("",[]),
 2361: 	    ok;
 2362: 	_ ->
 2363: 	    timer:sleep(1000),
 2364: 	    wait_nodes_down(Pang, N-1)
 2365:     end.
 2366: 
 2367: 
 2368: 
 2369: wait_nodes_up(Nodes, Tag) ->
 2370:     wait_nodes_up(Nodes, Tag, []).
 2371: 
 2372: wait_nodes_up(Nodes0, Tag, Apps) ->
 2373:     test_server:format("wait_nodes_up(~p, ~p, ~p):",[Nodes0, Tag, Apps]),
 2374:     Nodes = fix_nodes(Nodes0),
 2375:     wait_nodes_up(Nodes, Tag, lists:umerge(Apps,[kernel,stdlib,sasl]), 60).
 2376: 
 2377: fix_nodes([{Node,InitPid}|Nodes]) ->
 2378:     [{Node,InitPid} | fix_nodes(Nodes)];
 2379: fix_nodes([Node|Nodes]) ->
 2380:     [{Node,fake_init_pid} | fix_nodes(Nodes)];
 2381: fix_nodes([]) ->
 2382:     [].
 2383: 
 2384: wait_nodes_up(Nodes, Tag, Apps, 0) ->
 2385:     ct:fail({error, {"nodes not started", Nodes, Tag, Apps}});
 2386: wait_nodes_up(Nodes, Tag, Apps, N) ->
 2387:     Fun = 
 2388: 	fun(NodeInfo={Node,OldInitPid}, A) ->
 2389: 		case rpc:call(Node, application, which_applications, []) of
 2390: 		    {badrpc, nodedown} ->
 2391: 			test_server:format( "  ~p = {badarg, nodedown}",[Node]),
 2392: 			[NodeInfo | A];
 2393: 		    List when is_list(List)->
 2394: 			test_server:format( "  ~p = [~p]",[Node, List]),
 2395: 			case lists:all(fun(App) -> 
 2396: 					       lists:keymember(App,1,List) 
 2397: 				       end, Apps) of
 2398: 			    true ->
 2399: 				case rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[init]) of
 2400: 				    OldInitPid ->
 2401: 					[NodeInfo | A];
 2402: 				    _ ->
 2403: 					start_cover(Node),
 2404: 					A
 2405: 				end;
 2406: 			    false ->
 2407: 				[NodeInfo | A]
 2408: 			end
 2409: 		end
 2410: 	end,
 2411:     Pang = lists:foldl(Fun,[],Nodes),
 2412:     case Pang of
 2413: 	[] ->
 2414: 	    test_server:format("",[]),
 2415: 	    ok;
 2416: 	_ ->
 2417: 	    timer:sleep(2000),
 2418: 	    wait_nodes_up(Pang, Tag, Apps, N-1)
 2419:     end.
 2420: 
 2421: 
 2422: 
 2423: 
 2424: are_names_reg_gg(Node, Names) ->
 2425:     test_server:format( "are_names_reg_gg ~p~n",[Names]),
 2426:     are_names_reg_gg(Node, Names, 30).
 2427: 
 2428: are_names_reg_gg(Node, Names, N) ->
 2429:     case lists:sort(rpc:call(Node, global, registered_names, [])) of
 2430: 	Names ->
 2431: 	    ok;
 2432: 	Regs when N > 0 ->
 2433: 	    timer:sleep(1000),
 2434: 	    test_server:format( "are_names_reg_gg Regs ~p~n",[Regs]),
 2435: 	    are_names_reg_gg(Node, Names, N-1);
 2436: 	Regs ->
 2437: 	    ct:fail({error, {"Names not registered",
 2438: 			     {{"should :", Names},
 2439: 			      {"was :", Regs}}}})
 2440:     end.
 2441: 
 2442: 
 2443: 
 2444: t_start_node(Name, Boot, SysConfig) ->
 2445:     t_start_node(Name, Boot, SysConfig, "").
 2446: t_start_node(Name, Boot, SysConfig, ArgStr) ->
 2447:     Args = 
 2448: 	case Boot of
 2449: 	    [] -> [];
 2450: 	    _ -> " -boot " ++ Boot
 2451: 	end ++
 2452: 	case SysConfig of
 2453: 	    [] -> [];
 2454: 	    _ -> " -config " ++ SysConfig
 2455: 	end ++
 2456:         " " ++ ArgStr,
 2457:     test_server:start_node(Name, peer, [{args, Args}]).
 2458: 
 2459: stop_node(Node) ->
 2460:     test_server:stop_node(Node).
 2461: 
 2462: 
 2463: copy_client(Conf,Master,Sname,Client) ->
 2464:     test_server:format("copy_client(Conf)"),
 2465: 
 2466:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir, Conf),
 2467:     MasterDir = filename:join(priv_dir(Conf),Master),
 2468: 
 2469:     {ClientArgs,RelCliDir} = rh_test_lib:get_client_args(Client,Sname,MasterDir,
 2470: 							 node_name(Master)),
 2471: 
 2472:     Cli = filename:join([MasterDir, RelCliDir]),
 2473:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join([Cli,"bin","."])),
 2474:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join([Cli,"releases","."])),
 2475:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join([Cli,"log","."])),
 2476: 
 2477:     P1GOrig = filename:join([MasterDir, "releases", "P1G"]),
 2478:     ok = copy_tree(Conf,P1GOrig,filename:join(Cli,"releases")),
 2479:     
 2480:     case os:type() of
 2481: 	{unix,_} ->
 2482: 	    ok = subst_file(filename:join([DataDir, "start_client"]),
 2483: 			    filename:join([Cli,"bin","start"]),
 2484: 			    [{"ROOT",MasterDir},
 2485: 			     {"CLIENTARGS",ClientArgs}],
 2486: 			    [{chmod,8#0755}]);
 2487: 	_ ->
 2488: 	    ok
 2489:     end,
 2490:     
 2491:     StartErlData = filename:join([MasterDir, "releases", "start_erl.data"]),
 2492:     CliRelDir = filename:join([Cli, "releases"]),
 2493:     copy_file(StartErlData, CliRelDir),
 2494:     
 2495:     RR = filename:join([MasterDir, "releases", "RELEASES"]),
 2496:     copy_file(RR, CliRelDir),
 2497: 
 2498:     ok.
 2499: 
 2500: 
 2501: clean_priv_dir(Conf,Save) ->
 2502:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 2503:     rh_test_lib:clean_dir(PrivDir,Save),
 2504:     case file:list_dir(PrivDir) of
 2505: 	{ok,[]} -> _ = file:del_dir(PrivDir);
 2506: 	_ -> ok
 2507:     end.
 2508: 
 2509: node_name(Sname) when is_atom(Sname) ->
 2510:     {ok,Host} = inet:gethostname(),
 2511:     list_to_atom(atom_to_list(Sname) ++ "@" ++ Host).
 2512: 
 2513: copy_file(Src, Dest) ->
 2514:     copy_file(Src, Dest, []).
 2515: copy_file(Src, Dest, Opts) ->
 2516:     case file:copy(Src,Dest) of
 2517: 	{ok,_} ->
 2518: 	    preserve(Src,Dest,Opts),
 2519: 	    chmod(Dest,Opts),
 2520: 	    ok;
 2521: 	{error,eisdir} ->
 2522: 	    NewDest = filename:join(Dest, filename:basename(Src)),
 2523: 	    case file:copy(Src,NewDest) of
 2524: 		{ok,_} -> 
 2525: 		    preserve(Src,NewDest,Opts),
 2526: 		    chmod(NewDest,Opts);
 2527: 		{error,Reason} -> 
 2528: 		    copy_error(Src,Dest,Reason)
 2529: 	    end;
 2530: 	{error,Reason} ->
 2531: 	    copy_error(Src,Dest,Reason)
 2532:     end.
 2533: 
 2534: preserve(Src,Dest,Opts) ->
 2535:     case lists:member(preserve, Opts) of
 2536: 	true ->
 2537: 	    {ok, FileInfo} = file:read_file_info(Src),
 2538: 	    ok = file:write_file_info(Dest, FileInfo);
 2539: 	false ->
 2540: 	    ok
 2541:     end.
 2542: 
 2543: chmod(Dest,Opts) ->
 2544:     case lists:keyfind(chmod,1,Opts) of
 2545: 	{chmod,Mode} ->
 2546: 	    ok = file:change_mode(Dest, Mode);
 2547: 	false ->
 2548: 	    ok
 2549:     end.
 2550: 
 2551: 
 2552: 
 2553: copy_error(Src, Dest, Reason) ->
 2554:     test_server:format("Copy ~ts to ~ts failed: ~ts\n",
 2555: 	      [Src,Dest,file:format_error(Reason)]),
 2556:     ct:fail(file_copy_failed).
 2557: 
 2558: copy_tree(Conf, Src, DestDir) ->
 2559:     case catch copy_tree(Conf, Src, filename:basename(Src), DestDir) of
 2560: 	ok ->
 2561: 	    ok;
 2562: 	{'EXIT', {{badmatch,Error},_Stack}} ->
 2563: 	    %% Most probably, an erl_tar call has failed.
 2564: 	    %% Known to happen on some platforms (symbolic_link_too_long)
 2565: 	    Error;
 2566: 	{'EXIT', Reason} ->
 2567: 	    {error, Reason}
 2568:     end.
 2569: 
 2570: copy_tree(Conf, Src, NewName, DestDir) ->
 2571:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 2572:     TempTarName = filename:join(PrivDir, "temp_tar_file.tar"),
 2573:     %% Not compressing tar file here since that would increase test
 2574:     %% suite time by almost 100%, and the tar file is deleted
 2575:     %% immediately anyway.
 2576:     {ok,Tar} = erl_tar:open(TempTarName, [write]),
 2577:     ok = erl_tar:add(Tar, Src, NewName, []),
 2578:     ok = erl_tar:close(Tar),
 2579:     ok = erl_tar:extract(TempTarName, [{cwd,DestDir}]),
 2580:     ok = file:delete(TempTarName),
 2581:     ok.
 2582: 
 2583: %% subst_file(Src, Dest, Vars)
 2584: %% Src = Dest = string(), filename and path
 2585: %% Vars = [{Var, Val}]
 2586: %% Var = Val = string()
 2587: %% Substitute all occurrences of %Var% for Val in Src, using the list
 2588: %% of variables in Vars. Result is written to Dest.
 2589: %%
 2590: subst_file(Src, Dest, Vars) ->
 2591:     subst_file(Src, Dest, Vars, []).
 2592: subst_file(Src, Dest, Vars, Opts) ->
 2593:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Src),
 2594:     Conts = binary_to_list(Bin), % The source will always be latin1
 2595:     NConts = subst(Conts, Vars),
 2596:     %% The destination must be utf8 if file name encoding is unicode
 2597:     Enc = file:native_name_encoding(),
 2598:     ok = file:write_file(Dest, unicode:characters_to_binary(NConts,Enc,Enc)),
 2599:     preserve(Src,Dest,Opts),
 2600:     chmod(Dest,Opts).
 2601: 
 2602: subst(Str, Vars) ->
 2603:     subst(Str, Vars, []).
 2604: 
 2605: subst([$%, C| Rest], Vars, Result) when $A =< C, C =< $Z ->
 2606:     subst_var([C| Rest], Vars, Result, []);
 2607: subst([$%, C| Rest], Vars, Result) when $a =< C, C =< $z ->
 2608:     subst_var([C| Rest], Vars, Result, []);
 2609: subst([$%, C| Rest], Vars, Result) when  C == $_ ->
 2610:     subst_var([C| Rest], Vars, Result, []);
 2611: subst([C| Rest], Vars, Result) ->
 2612:     subst(Rest, Vars, [C| Result]);
 2613: subst([], _Vars, Result) ->
 2614:     lists:reverse(Result).
 2615: 
 2616: subst_var([$%| Rest], Vars, Result, VarAcc) ->
 2617:     Key = lists:reverse(VarAcc),
 2618:     case lists:keysearch(Key, 1, Vars) of
 2619:         {value, {Key, Value}} ->
 2620:             subst(Rest, Vars, lists:reverse(Value, Result));
 2621:         false ->
 2622:             subst(Rest, Vars, [$%| VarAcc ++ [$%| Result]])
 2623:     end;
 2624: subst_var([C| Rest], Vars, Result, VarAcc) ->
 2625:     subst_var(Rest, Vars, Result, [C| VarAcc]);
 2626: subst_var([], Vars, Result, VarAcc) ->
 2627:     subst([], Vars, [VarAcc ++ [$%| Result]]).
 2628: 
 2629: 
 2630: priv_dir(Conf) ->
 2631:     %% Due to problem with long paths on windows => creating a new
 2632:     %% priv_dir under data_dir
 2633:     %% And get rid of trailing slash (absname does that)
 2634:     %% And if file name translation mode is utf8, use a path with
 2635:     %% unicode characters
 2636:     PrivDir =
 2637: 	case file:native_name_encoding() of
 2638: 	    utf8 ->
 2639: 		"priv_dir_";
 2640: 	    _ ->
 2641: 		"priv_dir"
 2642: 	end,
 2643:     filename:absname(filename:join([?config(data_dir, Conf),PrivDir])).
 2644: 
 2645: init_priv_dir(Conf) ->
 2646:     Dir = priv_dir(Conf),
 2647:     case filelib:is_dir(Dir) of
 2648: 	true ->
 2649: 	    clean_priv_dir(Conf,false);
 2650: 	false ->
 2651: 	    ok
 2652:     end,
 2653:     filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(Dir,"*")).
 2654: 
 2655: latest_version(Dir) ->
 2656:     List = filelib:wildcard(Dir ++ "*"),
 2657:     lists:last(lists:sort(List)).
 2658: 
 2659: %% A printer process which receives messages from other nodes and
 2660: %% prints in the log
 2661: reg_print_proc() ->
 2662:     catch unregister(rh_print),
 2663:     Pid = spawn_link(?MODULE, rh_print, []),
 2664:     register(rh_print, Pid),
 2665:     ok.
 2666: 
 2667: rh_print() ->
 2668:     receive
 2669: 	{print, {Module,Line}, [H|T]} ->
 2670: 	    test_server:format("=== ~p:~p - ~tp",[Module,Line,H]),
 2671: 	    lists:foreach(fun(Term) -> test_server:format("    ~tp",[Term]) end, T),
 2672: 	    test_server:format("",[]),
 2673: 	    rh_print();
 2674: 	kill ->
 2675: 	    exit(normal)
 2676:     end.
 2677: 
 2678: stop_print_proc() ->
 2679:     case whereis(rh_print) of %%removes the printer process
 2680: 	undefined ->
 2681: 	    ok;
 2682: 	Pid when is_pid(Pid) ->
 2683: 	    rh_print ! kill
 2684:     end.
 2685: 
 2686: %% Create the first target release, vsn P1G. This release is used for
 2687: %% all test cases in {group,release}
 2688: create_p1g(Conf,TargetDir) ->
 2689:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Conf),
 2690:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 2691:     ErtsDir = app_dir(erts,old),
 2692:     KernelDir = app_dir(kernel,old),
 2693:     StdlibDir = app_dir(stdlib,old),
 2694: 
 2695:     %% Fake earlier version of kernel and stdlib
 2696:     SystemLib = system_lib(PrivDir),
 2697:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(SystemLib,"*")),
 2698:     KernelLib = code:lib_dir(kernel),
 2699:     StdlibLib = code:lib_dir(stdlib),
 2700:     ok = copy_tree(Conf,KernelLib,KernelDir,SystemLib),
 2701:     ok = copy_tree(Conf,StdlibLib,StdlibDir,SystemLib),
 2702:     fix_version(SystemLib,kernel),
 2703:     fix_version(SystemLib,stdlib),
 2704: 
 2705:     %% Create dirs
 2706:     BinDir = filename:join(TargetDir,bin),
 2707:     ReleasesDir = filename:join(TargetDir,releases),
 2708:     LogDir = filename:join(TargetDir,log),
 2709:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(BinDir,"*")),
 2710:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(ReleasesDir,"*")),
 2711:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(LogDir,"*")),
 2712: 
 2713:     %% Copy stuff 
 2714:     ErtsLatest = latest_version(filename:join(code:root_dir(),"erts")),
 2715:     ok = copy_tree(Conf, ErtsLatest, ErtsDir, TargetDir),
 2716:     ErtsBinDir = filename:join([TargetDir,ErtsDir,bin]),
 2717: 
 2718:     case os:type() of
 2719: 	{unix, _} ->
 2720: 	    copy_file(filename:join([ErtsBinDir, "epmd"]), BinDir, [preserve]),
 2721: 	    copy_file(filename:join([ErtsBinDir, "run_erl"]), BinDir, [preserve]),
 2722: 	    copy_file(filename:join([ErtsBinDir, "to_erl"]), BinDir, [preserve]),
 2723: 
 2724: 	    %% Create the start_erl shell script
 2725: 	    ok = subst_file(filename:join([ErtsBinDir,"start_erl.src"]),
 2726: 			    filename:join([BinDir,"start_erl"]),
 2727: 			    [{"EMU","beam"}],
 2728: 			    [{chmod,8#0755}]);
 2729: 	{win32,_} ->
 2730: 	    %% Add a batch file to use as HEART_COMMAND
 2731: 	    ok = copy_file(filename:join(DataDir, "heart_restart.bat"),
 2732: 			   ErtsBinDir,[preserve])
 2733:     end,
 2734: 
 2735:     copy_file(filename:join(DataDir, "../installer.beam"),
 2736: 	      filename:join([DataDir,lib,"installer-1.0",ebin])),
 2737:     copy_file(filename:join(DataDir, "../rh_test_lib.beam"),
 2738: 	      filename:join([DataDir,lib,"installer-1.0",ebin])),
 2739:     copy_file(filename:join(DataDir, "../otp_vsns.beam"),
 2740: 	      filename:join([DataDir,lib,"installer-1.0",ebin])),
 2741: 
 2742:     InstPrivDir = filename:join([DataDir,lib,"installer-1.0","priv"]),
 2743:     case file:read_file_info(InstPrivDir) of
 2744:         {ok, _} ->
 2745:             ok;
 2746:         _ ->
 2747:             ok = file:make_dir(InstPrivDir)
 2748:     end,
 2749:     copy_file(filename:join(DataDir, "../otp_versions.table"), InstPrivDir),
 2750: 
 2751:     %% Create .rel, .script and .boot files
 2752:     RelName = "rel0",
 2753:     RelVsn = "P1G",
 2754:     RelDir = filename:join(PrivDir,RelName),
 2755:     RelFileName = filename:join(RelDir,RelName),
 2756:     RelFile = RelFileName ++ ".rel",
 2757:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(RelFile),
 2758: 
 2759:     TarFile = create_basic_release(Conf,RelFile,RelVsn,{old,false}),
 2760: 
 2761:     %% Extract tar file in target directory (i.e. same directory as erts etc.)
 2762:     ok = erl_tar:extract(TarFile, [{cwd, TargetDir}, compressed]),
 2763: 
 2764:     %% Create start_erl.data
 2765:     StartErlDataFile = filename:join([ReleasesDir, "start_erl.data"]),
 2766:     StartErlData = io_lib:fwrite("~s ~s~n", [vsn(erts,old), RelVsn]),
 2767:     ok = file:write_file(StartErlDataFile, StartErlData),
 2768: 
 2769:     %% Create RELEASES
 2770:     ok = release_handler:create_RELEASES(TargetDir,ReleasesDir,RelFile,[]),
 2771: 
 2772:     ok.
 2773: 
 2774: fix_version(SystemLib,App) ->
 2775:     FromVsn = re:replace(vsn(App,current),"\\.","\\\\.",[{return,binary}]),
 2776:     ToVsn = re:replace(vsn(App,old),"\\.","\\\\.",[{return,binary}]),
 2777:     Rootname = filename:join([SystemLib,app_dir(App,old),ebin,atom_to_list(App)]),
 2778: 
 2779:     AppFile = Rootname ++ ".app",
 2780:     {ok,OrigApp} = file:read_file(AppFile),
 2781:     ok = file:write_file(AppFile,re:replace(OrigApp,FromVsn,ToVsn,
 2782: 					    [{return,binary}])),
 2783:     AppupFile = Rootname ++ ".appup",
 2784:     {ok,OrigAppup} = file:read_file(AppupFile),
 2785:     ok = file:write_file(AppupFile,re:replace(OrigAppup,FromVsn,ToVsn,
 2786: 					      [{return,binary}])).
 2787: 
 2788: 
 2789: %% Create version P1H - which is P1G + a-1.0
 2790: %% Must have run create_p1g first!!
 2791: create_p1h(Conf) ->
 2792:     create_upgrade_release(Conf,"rel1","P1H",{old,false},[{a,"1.0"}],
 2793: 			   [{a,[{key2,val2}]}],[{"rel0",[new_appl]}]).
 2794: 
 2795: %% Create version P1I - which is P1H, but with application a upgraded to a-1.1
 2796: %% Must have run create_p1h first!!
 2797: create_p1i(Conf) ->
 2798:     create_upgrade_release(Conf,"rel2","P1I",{old,false},[{a,"1.1"}],
 2799: 			   [{a,[{key2,newval2}]}],
 2800: 			   [{"rel1",[{extra,gott}]}]).
 2801: 
 2802: %% Create version P2A - which is P1I, but with erts-<latest>
 2803: %% Must have run create_p1i first!!
 2804: create_p2a(Conf) ->
 2805:     create_upgrade_release(Conf,"rel3","P2A",{current,code:root_dir()},
 2806: 			   [{a,"1.1"}],[{a,[{key2,newval2}]}],
 2807: 			   [{"rel1",[new_emu,new_appl]},{"rel2",[new_emu]}],
 2808: 			   [{"rel1",[old_emu,old_appl]},{"rel2",[old_emu]}]).
 2809: 
 2810: %% Create version P2B - which is P2A, but with relup containing an
 2811: %% extra reboot.
 2812: %% Can be upgraded to from P1G - so must have run create_p1g first!!
 2813: create_p2b(Conf) ->
 2814:     create_upgrade_release(Conf,"rel4","P2B",{current,code:root_dir()},
 2815: 			   [{a,"1.1"}],[{a,[{key2,newval2}]}],
 2816: 			   [{"rel0",[new_emu,add_appl]}],
 2817: 			   [{"rel0",[old_emu,rm_appl]}],
 2818: 			   [restart_emulator]).
 2819: 
 2820: %% Create a release tar package which can be installed on top of P1G
 2821: create_upgrade_release(Conf,RelName,RelVsn,Erts,Apps,Config,UpFrom) ->
 2822:     create_upgrade_release(Conf,RelName,RelVsn,Erts,Apps,Config,UpFrom,[]).
 2823: create_upgrade_release(Conf,RelName,RelVsn,Erts,Apps,Config,UpFrom,DownTo) ->
 2824:     create_upgrade_release(Conf,RelName,RelVsn,Erts,Apps,Config,UpFrom,DownTo,[]).
 2825: create_upgrade_release(Conf,RelName,RelVsn,Erts,Apps,Config,UpFrom0,DownTo0,RelupOpts) ->
 2826:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 2827:     RelDir = filename:join(PrivDir,RelName),
 2828:     RelFileName = filename:join(RelDir,RelName),
 2829:     RelFile = RelFileName ++ ".rel",
 2830:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(RelFile),
 2831: 
 2832:     UpFrom = [{filename:join([PrivDir,UpFromName,UpFromName]),Descr} ||
 2833: 		 {UpFromName,Descr} <- UpFrom0],
 2834:     DownTo = [{filename:join([PrivDir,DownToName,DownToName]),Descr} ||
 2835: 		 {DownToName,Descr} <- DownTo0],
 2836: 
 2837:     create_basic_release(Conf,RelFile,RelVsn,Erts,Apps,Config,
 2838: 			 UpFrom,DownTo,RelupOpts),
 2839:     ok.
 2840: 
 2841: %% Create .rel, .script, .boot, sys.config and tar
 2842: create_basic_release(Conf,RelFile,RelVsn,{Erts,ErtsDir}) ->
 2843:     create_basic_release(Conf, RelFile,RelVsn,{Erts,ErtsDir},[],[],[],[],[]).
 2844: create_basic_release(Conf,RelFile,RelVsn,{Erts,ErtsDir},ExtraApps,Config,UpFrom,DownTo,RelupOpts) ->
 2845:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Conf),
 2846:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 2847:     SystemLib = system_lib(PrivDir),
 2848:     LibPath = [filename:join([SystemLib,"*",ebin]),
 2849: 	       filename:join([DataDir,lib,"*",ebin])],
 2850: 
 2851:     RelDir = filename:dirname(RelFile),
 2852:     RelFileName = filename:rootname(RelFile),
 2853: 
 2854:     %% Create .rel file
 2855:     create_installer_rel_file(RelFile,RelVsn,Erts,ExtraApps),
 2856: 
 2857:     %% Generate .script and .boot
 2858:     ok = systools:make_script(RelFileName,
 2859: 			      [{path,LibPath},
 2860: 			       {outdir,RelDir}]),
 2861: 
 2862:     %% Generate relup
 2863:     ok = systools:make_relup(RelFileName,UpFrom,DownTo,[{path,LibPath},
 2864: 							{outdir,RelDir} |
 2865: 							RelupOpts]),
 2866: 
 2867:     %% Create sys.config
 2868:     ok = write_term_file(filename:join(RelDir,"sys.config"),Config),
 2869: 
 2870: 
 2871:     %% Create tar file (i.e. collect all lib/app-*/* and system files)
 2872:     ok = systools:make_tar(RelFileName,
 2873: 			   [{path,LibPath},
 2874: 			    {outdir,RelDir} |
 2875: 			    case ErtsDir of
 2876: 				false -> [];
 2877: 				_ -> [{erts,ErtsDir}]
 2878: 			    end]),
 2879:     
 2880:     TarFileName = RelFileName ++ ".tar.gz",
 2881: 
 2882:     case os:type() of
 2883: 	{win32,_} when ErtsDir=/=false -> modify_tar_win32(Conf, TarFileName);
 2884: 	_ -> ok
 2885:     end,
 2886: 
 2887:     TarFileName.
 2888: 
 2889: %% Create a .rel file
 2890: create_installer_rel_file(RelFile,RelVsn,Erts,ExtraApps) ->
 2891:     create_rel_file(RelFile,"SASL-test",RelVsn,Erts,
 2892: 		    [{installer,"1.0"}|ExtraApps]).
 2893: 
 2894: create_rel_file(RelFile,RelName,RelVsn,Erts,ExtraApps) ->
 2895:     ErtsVsn = vsn(erts,Erts),
 2896:     KernelVsn = vsn(kernel,Erts),
 2897:     StdlibVsn = vsn(stdlib,Erts),
 2898:     SaslVsn = vsn(sasl,current),
 2899:     application:load(tools),
 2900:     ToolsVsn = vsn(tools,current),
 2901:     application:load(runtime_tools),
 2902:     RuntimeToolsVsn = vsn(runtime_tools,current),
 2903:     
 2904:     RelFileContent = {release,
 2905: 		      {RelName, RelVsn},
 2906: 		      {erts, ErtsVsn},
 2907: 		      [{kernel, KernelVsn},
 2908: 		       {stdlib, StdlibVsn},
 2909: 		       {sasl, SaslVsn},
 2910: 		       {runtime_tools, RuntimeToolsVsn},
 2911: 		       {tools, ToolsVsn} |
 2912: 		       ExtraApps]},
 2913:     ok = write_term_file(RelFile,RelFileContent).
 2914: 
 2915: %% Insert a term in a file, which can be read with file:consult/1.
 2916: write_term_file(File,Term) ->
 2917:     Str = io_lib:format("%% ~s~n~tp.~n",[epp:encoding_to_string(utf8),Term]),
 2918:     Bin = unicode:characters_to_binary(Str),
 2919:     ok = file:write_file(File,Bin).
 2920:     
 2921: 
 2922: %% Check that global group info is correct - try again for a maximum of 5 sec
 2923: check_gg_info(Node,OtherAlive,OtherDead,Synced) ->
 2924:     check_gg_info(Node,OtherAlive,OtherDead,Synced,5).
 2925: 
 2926: check_gg_info(Node,OtherAlive,OtherDead,Synced,N) ->
 2927:     GGI = rpc:call(Node, global_group, info, []),
 2928:     try do_check_gg_info(OtherAlive,OtherDead,Synced,GGI) 
 2929:     catch _:E:Stacktrace ->
 2930: 	    test_server:format("~nERROR: check_gg_info failed for ~p:~n~p~n"
 2931: 		      "when GGI was: ~p~n",
 2932: 		      [Node,{E,Stacktrace},GGI]),
 2933:             if N == 0 ->
 2934:                     ct:fail("check_gg_info failed");
 2935:                true ->
 2936:                     ok = rpc:call(Node, global_group, sync, []),
 2937:                     timer:sleep(1000),
 2938:                     check_gg_info(Node,OtherAlive,OtherDead,Synced,N-1)
 2939:             end
 2940:     end.
 2941: 
 2942: do_check_gg_info(OtherAlive,OtherDead,Synced,GGI) ->
 2943:     {_,gg1} = lists:keyfind(own_group_name,1,GGI),
 2944:     {_,synced} = lists:keyfind(state,1,GGI),
 2945:     {_,AllNodes} = lists:keyfind(own_group_nodes,1,GGI),
 2946:     true = lists:sort(AllNodes) =:= lists:sort(OtherAlive++OtherDead),
 2947:     {_,[]} = lists:keyfind(sync_error,1,GGI),
 2948:     {_,[{gg2,[_,_]}]} = lists:keyfind(other_groups,1,GGI),
 2949:     {_,SyncedNodes} = lists:keyfind(synced_nodes,1,GGI),
 2950:     true = lists:sort(SyncedNodes) =:= lists:sort(Synced),
 2951:     {_,NoContact} = lists:keyfind(no_contact,1,GGI),
 2952:     true = lists:sort(NoContact) =:= lists:sort(OtherDead),
 2953:     ok.
 2954: 
 2955: %% Return the configuration (to be inserted in sys.config) for global group tests
 2956: gg_config(Snames) ->
 2957:     Nodes = [node_name(Sname) || Sname <- Snames],
 2958:     [{kernel, [{sync_nodes_optional, Nodes},
 2959: 	       {sync_nodes_timeout, 10000},
 2960: 	       {global_groups, 
 2961: 		[{gg1, Nodes},
 2962: 		 {gg2, [node_name(Sname) || Sname <- [ggq,ggw]]}]}]},
 2963:      {a, [{key2, val2}]}].
 2964: 
 2965: %% Start a node with short name SnameStr, and unpack P1H
 2966: unpack_p1h(Conf,Sname) ->
 2967:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 2968:     [Node] = start_nodes(Conf,[Sname],"create_p1h"),
 2969:     ok = rpc_inst(Node, unpack_p1h, [PrivDir]),
 2970:     Node.
 2971: 
 2972: %% On the given node, install P1H and make it permanent
 2973: %% This function is to be called after unpack_p1h/2, with the same node.
 2974: permanent_p1h(Node) ->
 2975:     ok = rpc_inst(Node, permanent_p1h, []).
 2976: 
 2977: %% For each node in ToNodes, create a target installation which is
 2978: %% identical to the target installation for FromNode.
 2979: copy_installed(Conf,FromNode,ToNodes) ->
 2980:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 2981:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Conf),
 2982: 
 2983:     %% Instead of using copy_tree on the complete node directory, I'm
 2984:     %% splitting this in separate tar files per subdirectory so the
 2985:     %% log directory can be completely skipped. The reason for this is
 2986:     %% that the tar file might become faulty if the node is alive and
 2987:     %% writing to the log while the tar is created.
 2988:     FromDir = filename:join(PrivDir,FromNode),
 2989:     {ok,FromDirNames} = file:list_dir(FromDir),
 2990:     TempTarFiles =
 2991: 	[begin
 2992: 	     TempTarFile = filename:join(PrivDir,"temp_" ++ FDN ++ ".tar"),
 2993: 	     {ok,Tar} = erl_tar:open(TempTarFile,[write]),
 2994: 	     ok = erl_tar:add(Tar,filename:join(FromDir,FDN),FDN,[]),
 2995: 	     ok = erl_tar:close(Tar),
 2996: 	     TempTarFile
 2997:          end || FDN <- FromDirNames, FDN=/="log"],
 2998:     lists:foreach(
 2999:       fun(Node) ->
 3000: 	      NodeDir = filename:join(PrivDir,Node),
 3001: 	      ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join([NodeDir,"log","*"])),
 3002:               lists:foreach(
 3003: 		fun(TempTarFile) ->
 3004:                         ok = erl_tar:extract(TempTarFile,[{cwd,NodeDir}])
 3005: 		end, TempTarFiles),
 3006: 	      case os:type() of
 3007: 		  {unix,_} ->
 3008: 		      %% Create start script
 3009: 		      %% Using a customized start script from DataDir
 3010: 		      %% where some options (heart and nodename) are
 3011: 		      %% added compared to the start.src in the erlang
 3012: 		      %% distribution.
 3013: 		      ok = subst_file(filename:join(DataDir, "start"),
 3014: 				      filename:join([NodeDir, "bin", "start"]),
 3015: 				      [{"ROOT",NodeDir}],
 3016: 				      [preserve]);
 3017: 		  {win32,_} ->
 3018: 		      %% Write erl.ini
 3019: 		      ErtsDirs =
 3020: 			  filelib:wildcard(filename:join(NodeDir,"erts-*")),
 3021: 		      lists:foreach(
 3022: 			fun(ErtsDir) ->
 3023: 				ok = subst_file(
 3024: 				       filename:join(DataDir, "erl.ini.src"),
 3025: 				       filename:join([ErtsDir, "bin", "erl.ini"]),
 3026: 				       [{"ROOTDIR",NodeDir},
 3027: 					{"BINDIR",filename:join(ErtsDir,"bin")}])
 3028: 			end,
 3029: 			ErtsDirs),
 3030: 
 3031: 		      %% The service on windows runs as local
 3032: 		      %% administrator (not otptest user), so we need
 3033: 		      %% to chmod the release in order to allow the
 3034: 		      %% executing node to install releases, write
 3035: 		      %% logs etc.
 3036: 		      chmod_release_win32(NodeDir)
 3037: 	      end
 3038:       end,
 3039:       ToNodes),
 3040: 
 3041:     lists:foreach(fun(TempTarFile) -> file:delete(TempTarFile) end, TempTarFiles),
 3042:     ok.
 3043: 
 3044: chmod_release_win32(Dir) ->
 3045:     os:cmd("echo y|cacls " ++ Dir ++ " /T /E /G Administrators:F").
 3046: 
 3047: start_nodes(Conf,Snames,Tag) ->
 3048:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 3049:     Nodes = 
 3050: 	lists:map(
 3051: 	  fun(Sname) ->
 3052: 		  NodeDir = filename:join(PrivDir,Sname),
 3053: 		  Node = node_name(Sname),
 3054: 
 3055: 		  case os:type() of
 3056: 		      {unix,_} ->
 3057: 			  start_node_unix(Sname,NodeDir);
 3058: 		      {win32,_} ->
 3059: 			  start_node_win32(Sname,NodeDir)
 3060: 		  end,
 3061: 		  Node
 3062: 	  end,
 3063: 	  Snames),
 3064:     wait_nodes_up(Nodes,Tag),
 3065:     Nodes.
 3066:     
 3067: start_node_unix(Sname,NodeDir) ->
 3068:     Script = filename:join([NodeDir,"bin","start"]),
 3069:     test_server:format("Starting ~p: ~ts~n", [Sname,Script]),
 3070:     case rh_test_lib:cmd(Script,[],[{"NODENAME",atom_to_list(Sname)}]) of
 3071: 	ok ->
 3072: 	    {ok,node_name(Sname)};
 3073:         Error ->
 3074:             ct:fail({failed_to_start_node, Sname, Error})
 3075:     end.
 3076: 
 3077: 
 3078: start_node_win32(Sname,NodeDir) ->
 3079:     Name = atom_to_list(Sname) ++ "_P1G",
 3080:     ErtsBinDir = filename:join([NodeDir,app_dir(erts,old),"bin"]),
 3081: 
 3082:     StartErlArgs = rh_test_lib:get_start_erl_args(NodeDir),
 3083:     ServiceArgs = rh_test_lib:get_service_args(NodeDir, Sname, StartErlArgs),
 3084: 
 3085:     Erlsrv = filename:nativename(filename:join(ErtsBinDir,"erlsrv")),
 3086:     rh_test_lib:erlsrv(Erlsrv,stop,Name),
 3087:     rh_test_lib:erlsrv(Erlsrv,remove,Name),
 3088:     ok = rh_test_lib:erlsrv(Erlsrv,add,Name,ServiceArgs),
 3089:     ok = rh_test_lib:erlsrv(Erlsrv,start,Name),
 3090:     ok.
 3091: 
 3092: %% Create a unique node name for each test case
 3093: tc_sname(Config) ->
 3094:     tc_sname(Config,"").
 3095: tc_sname(Config,Fix) when is_atom(Fix) ->
 3096:     tc_sname(Config,atom_to_list(Fix));
 3097: tc_sname(Config,Fix) when is_list(Fix) ->
 3098:     list_to_atom(
 3099:       atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 3100:       ++ "-" ++ atom_to_list(?config(sname_prefix, Config)) ++
 3101: 	  case Fix of
 3102: 	      "" -> "";
 3103: 	      _ -> "-" ++ Fix
 3104: 	  end).
 3105: 
 3106: tc_full_node_name(Config) ->
 3107:     tc_full_node_name(Config,"").
 3108: tc_full_node_name(Config,Fix) ->
 3109:     node_name(tc_sname(Config,Fix)).
 3110: 
 3111: 
 3112: %% When installing a release for which the sys.config includes added
 3113: %% or changed global group(s), this node (test_sever@host) will be
 3114: %% disconnected from the test node (Node) by global_group.erl. This
 3115: %% will cause the rpc:call to terminate with {badrpc,nodedown} even if
 3116: %% the installation succeeds. This function installs the release,
 3117: %% accepts the faulty return value and then checks if the release was
 3118: %% successfully installed.
 3119: install_release_changed_gg(Node,RelVsn) ->
 3120:     stop_cover(Node),
 3121:     {badrpc,nodedown} = rpc:call(Node,release_handler,install_release,[RelVsn]),
 3122:     timer:sleep(100),
 3123:     wait_installed(Node,RelVsn,4).
 3124: 
 3125: wait_installed(Node,RelVsn,0) ->
 3126:     ct:fail("install_release_changed_gg failed for " ++ RelVsn ++
 3127: 	    " on " ++ atom_to_list(Node));
 3128: wait_installed(Node,RelVsn,N) ->
 3129:     Rels = rpc:call(Node,release_handler,which_releases,[]),
 3130:     case lists:keyfind(RelVsn, 2, Rels) of
 3131: 	{"SASL-test", RelVsn, _Libs, current} -> 
 3132: 	    start_cover(Node),
 3133: 	    ok;
 3134: 	_ -> 
 3135: 	    timer:sleep(500),
 3136: 	    wait_installed(Node,RelVsn,N-1)
 3137:     end.
 3138: 
 3139: %% Start/stop cover measurements on the given node
 3140: start_cover(Node) ->
 3141:     cover_fun(Node,start).
 3142: stop_cover(Node) ->
 3143:     cover_fun(Node,stop).
 3144: 
 3145: cover_fun(Node,Func) ->
 3146:     case test_server:is_cover() of
 3147: 	true ->
 3148: 	    cover:Func(Node);
 3149: 	false ->
 3150: 	    ok
 3151:     end.
 3152: 
 3153: %%%-----------------------------------------------------------------
 3154: %%% Create a fake release ....
 3155: 
 3156: %% This function will create and install a release build on the
 3157: %% current running OTP release. It includes kernel, stdlib and sasl,
 3158: %% and possibly other applications if they are listed in AppDirs =
 3159: %% [{App,Vsn,LibDir}]
 3160: create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,AppDirs) ->
 3161:     create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,init:script_id(),AppDirs).
 3162: create_and_install_fake_first_release(Conf,Dir,{RelName,RelVsn},AppDirs) ->
 3163:     {Rel,_} = create_fake_release(Dir,RelName,RelVsn,AppDirs),
 3164:     ReleasesDir = filename:join(Dir, "releases"),
 3165:     RelDir = filename:dirname(Rel),
 3166: 
 3167:     %% And install it
 3168:     RelVsnDir = filename:join(ReleasesDir, RelVsn),
 3169:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(RelVsnDir,"*")),
 3170: 
 3171:     ok = copy_file(Rel++".rel",RelVsnDir),
 3172:     ok = copy_file(Rel++".boot",filename:join(RelVsnDir, "start.boot")),
 3173:     ok = copy_file(filename:join(RelDir,"sys.config"),RelVsnDir),
 3174: 
 3175:     case proplists:get_value(root_dir, Conf, relative) of
 3176:         relative ->
 3177:             ok = release_handler:create_RELEASES(
 3178:                    ReleasesDir,
 3179:                    Rel++".rel",
 3180:                    AppDirs);
 3181:         absolute ->
 3182:             ok = release_handler:create_RELEASES(
 3183:                    code:root_dir(),
 3184:                    ReleasesDir,
 3185:                    Rel++".rel",
 3186:                    AppDirs)
 3187:     end,
 3188:     Rel.
 3189: 
 3190: %% This function create a new release, including a relup file. It can
 3191: %% be upgraded to from the release created by
 3192: %% create_and_install_fake_first_release/2. Unpack first by calls to
 3193: %% release_handler:set_unpacked and release_handler:install_file.
 3194: create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,RelVsn,AppDirs,UpgrInstr) when not is_tuple(RelVsn) ->
 3195:     {RelName,_} = init:script_id(),
 3196:     create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,{RelName,RelVsn},AppDirs,UpgrInstr);
 3197: create_fake_upgrade_release(Dir,{RelName,RelVsn},AppDirs,{UpFrom,DownTo,ExtraLibs}) ->
 3198:     %% Create a new release
 3199:     {Rel,Paths} = create_fake_release(Dir,RelName,RelVsn,AppDirs),
 3200:     RelDir = filename:dirname(Rel),
 3201: 
 3202:     %% And a relup file so it can be upgraded to
 3203:     RelupPath = Paths ++ [filename:join([Lib,"*","ebin"]) || Lib <- ExtraLibs],
 3204:     ok = systools:make_relup(Rel,UpFrom,DownTo,[{path,RelupPath},
 3205: 						{outdir,RelDir}]),
 3206:     
 3207:     Rel.
 3208: 
 3209: 
 3210: create_fake_release(Dir,RelName,RelVsn,AppDirs) ->
 3211:     %% Create .rel files
 3212:     RelDir = filename:join(Dir,"rel_" ++ RelVsn),
 3213:     Rel = filename:join([RelDir,"rel_" ++ RelVsn]),
 3214:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Rel),
 3215: 
 3216:     {Apps,Paths} = 
 3217: 	lists:foldl(fun({App,Vsn,Lib},{As,Ps}) ->
 3218: 			    {[{App,Vsn}|As],
 3219: 			     lists:umerge([filename:join([Lib,"*",ebin])],Ps)}
 3220: 		    end,
 3221: 		    {[],[]},
 3222: 		    AppDirs),
 3223: 
 3224:     create_rel_file(Rel++".rel",RelName,RelVsn,current,Apps),
 3225:     
 3226:     %% Generate boot scripts
 3227:     ok = systools:make_script(Rel,[local,
 3228: 				   {path, Paths},
 3229: 				   {outdir,RelDir}]),
 3230:     ok = copy_file(Rel++".boot", filename:join(RelDir,"start.boot")),
 3231: 
 3232:     %% Use an own 'releases' directory - we don't want to change the
 3233:     %% contents of $OTPROOT/releases
 3234:     %% Inform SASL about this via sys.config
 3235:     ReleasesDir = filename:join(Dir, "releases"),
 3236:     Config = [{sasl,[{releases_dir,ReleasesDir}]}],
 3237:     ok = write_term_file(filename:join(RelDir,"sys.config"), Config),
 3238:     
 3239:     {Rel,Paths}.
 3240:     
 3241: 
 3242: rpc_inst(Node,Func,Args) ->
 3243:     rpc:call(Node,installer,Func,[node()|Args]).
 3244: 
 3245: delete_all_services() ->
 3246:     ErlSrv = erlsrv:erlsrv(erlang:system_info(version)),
 3247:     [_|Serviceinfo] = string:tokens(os:cmd("\"" ++ ErlSrv ++ "\" list"),"\n"),
 3248:     Services =
 3249: 	[lists:takewhile(fun($\t) -> false; (_) -> true end,S)
 3250: 	 || S <- Serviceinfo],
 3251:     test_server:format("Services to remove: ~p~n",[Services]),
 3252:     lists:foreach(fun(S) ->
 3253: 			  rh_test_lib:erlsrv(ErlSrv,stop,S),
 3254: 			  rh_test_lib:erlsrv(ErlSrv,remove,S)
 3255: 		  end,
 3256: 		  Services).
 3257: 
 3258: modify_tar_win32(Conf, TarFileName) ->
 3259:     DataDir = ?config(data_dir,Conf),
 3260:     PrivDir = priv_dir(Conf),
 3261:     TmpDir = filename:join(PrivDir,"tmp_modify_tar_win32"),
 3262:     ok = erl_tar:extract(TarFileName,[{cwd,TmpDir},compressed]),
 3263: 
 3264:     ErtsBinDir = filelib:wildcard(filename:join([TmpDir,"erts-*","bin"])),
 3265:     ok = copy_file(filename:join(DataDir, "heart_restart.bat"),
 3266: 		   ErtsBinDir,[preserve]),
 3267: 
 3268:     {ok,Fs} = file:list_dir(TmpDir),
 3269:     {ok,T} = erl_tar:open(TarFileName,[write,compressed]),
 3270:     [ok = erl_tar:add(T,filename:join(TmpDir,F),F,[]) || F <- Fs],
 3271:     ok = erl_tar:close(T),
 3272:     ok.
 3273: 
 3274: app_dir(App,Vsn) ->
 3275:     atom_to_list(App) ++ "-" ++ vsn(App,Vsn).
 3276: vsn(App,old) -> rh_test_lib:old_app_vsn(App);
 3277: vsn(erts,current) -> erlang:system_info(version);
 3278: vsn(App,current) ->
 3279:     {ok,Vsn} = application:get_key(App,vsn),
 3280:     Vsn.
 3281: 
 3282: system_lib(PrivDir) ->
 3283:     filename:join(PrivDir,"system_lib").
 3284: 
 3285: copy_r(Src, Dst) ->
 3286:     {ok,S} = file:read_file_info(Src),
 3287:     case S#file_info.type of
 3288:         directory ->
 3289:             {ok,Names} = file:list_dir(Src),
 3290:             ok = filelib:ensure_dir(Dst),
 3291:             ok = file:make_dir(Dst),
 3292:             lists:foreach(
 3293:               fun(Name) ->
 3294:                       copy_r(filename:join(Src, Name),
 3295:                              filename:join(Dst, Name))
 3296:               end, Names);
 3297:         _ ->
 3298:             {ok,_NumBytesCopied} = file:copy(Src, Dst),
 3299:             ok = file:write_file_info(Dst, S)
 3300:     end.
